0.title: Russian athletes to leave Beijing, will not appeal Paralympics ban
0.article_body: The Russian Paralympic Committee (RPC) on Friday said its contingent in Beijing will leave China after being banned from competing following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, adding it will not appeal the decision. The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Thursday banned Russian and Belarusian athletes from participating in the Games after initially allowing them to compete as neutral athletes.

1.title: BJP will always keeps its promises no matter what the cost: Rajnath
1.article_body: Speaking at an election rally in Jaunpur, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Friday said that the BJP never breaks the trust of people and fulfils promises it makes no matter what the cost. Notably, he also said that individuals from BJP may be unable to fulfil their promises. Singh claimed BJP will win around 300 seats in UP Assembly polls.

2.title: Cheating case accused escapes from police custody in Chandigarh
2.article_body: An accused in a cheating case escaped from police custody at the Sector 8 market in Chandigarh on Thursday. The man has been identified as Himanshu Kakkria. The police later recovered a pistol from his Toyota Fortuner parked in the market. "He managed to flee with his wife and their acquaintance," said Naveen Pal, Station House Officer, Mattaur, Mohali.

3.title: Shane Warne produced 'ball of the century' with his 1st ever Ashes delivery
3.article_body: Legendary Australian spinner Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 of a suspected heart attack in Thailand, bowled a big leg-break as his first delivery in Ashes to clean bowl Mike Gatting on June 4, 1993. The flighted delivery drifted in, then dipped and eventually hit Gatting's off-stump with sharp turn and is popularly known as "ball of the century".

4.title: Former world no. 1 Murray to renew Ivan Lendl as coach for a 3rd stint
4.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray is set to renew his relationship with eight-time Grand Slam winner Ivan Lendl as his coach for a third stint together. They first worked together from 2011 to 2014, then from 2016 to 2017. Their partnership between 2012 and 2016 led to Murray winning three Grand Slam titles and two consecutive Olympic gold medals.

5.title: Murray receives wild card into ATP Masters 1000 event in Indian Wells
5.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray has been given a wild card entry into the upcoming ATP Masters 1000 event, the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. Murray previously reached the final of the tournament in 2009, where he lost to Rafael Nadal. Murray was beaten by Alexander Zverev 6-4, 7-6(4) in the third round of the tournament last year.

6.title: Russian lawmakers pass bill imposing jail for fake news about army
6.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Friday passed a bill imposing jail term of up to 15 years for intentionally spreading fake news about country's armed forces. This comes as Russian officials have repeatedly accused US and European allies of spreading false information against Russia. The law will be enforced only after the bill is signed by President Vladimir Putin.

7.title: Ukraine, Japan discuss Russian attack at Ukrainian nuclear plant site
7.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday informed Japanese PM Fumio Kishida about Russia's "nuclear terrorism" at Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant. "We both agree on the gravity of threats to global security," Zelenskyy said. He also shared details of blaze at the nuclear plant site with Kishida. Earlier, a fire broke out at Europe's biggest nuclear plant due to Russian shelling.

8.title: He was always magical on the field: Raina on Shane Warne’s death
8.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Suresh Raina condoled the death of former Australian spinner Shane Warne on Twitter, saying, "At loss of words to hear the demise of our cricketing legend Shane Warne, he was always magical on the field. May peace be with you. My heartfelt condolences to his family and loved ones." Warne died of a suspected heart attack.

9.title: RIP my hero, totally shattered: Harbhajan on Shane Warne's death
9.article_body: Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh on Friday condoled the demise of Shane Warne, who passed away due to a suspected heart attack. "Nooooooooooooooo can't believe you are no more Shane Warne," tweeted Harbhajan. "RIP my HERO...don't wanna believe this...totally shattered," he added. Warne died at the age of 52.

10.title: Microsoft suspends sales of products & services in Russia
10.article_body:
Microsoft on Friday announced that it was suspending new sales of its products and services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Microsoft added that it will proactively work to help 
cybersecurity officials in Ukraine defend against Russian attacks. "We stand with Ukraine in calling for the restoration of peace, respect for Ukraine’s sovereignty," the company added.

11.title: Nation will remain indebted to him: PM on demise of ex-Army chief
11.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday condoled the demise of former Army chief SF Rodrigues and tweeted that the "nation will remain indebted to him for his exceptional service and contribution towards making India stronger". He added, "He was respected for his deep strategic knowledge. My thoughts are with his family and friends." Rodrigues passed away at the age of 88.

12.title: SP only party to raise issue of unemployment in UP: Mulayam
12.article_body: Samajwadi Party patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav on Friday claimed that it was only the SP party that raised the issue of unemployment in Uttar Pradesh, adding that the party would provide employment opportunities to youth if it forms the government in the state. He said, "The party has always worked for poor, youth, uneducated and the ignored sections of society."

13.title: 'Goal by July is to get back in shape': Shane Warne in his last Instagram post
13.article_body: Ex-Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, who passed away in Thailand, had shared a post on Instagram four days ago revealing his plan to get in shape by July. Sharing a throwback picture, he had written, "Operation shred has started (10 days in) and...goal by July is to get back to this shape from a few years ago! Let’s go."

14.title: No words to describe how shocked I am: Shoaib Akhtar on Shane Warne's death
14.article_body: Former Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Akhtar took to Twitter to condole the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who died on Friday in Thailand. Sharing his picture, Akhtar wrote, "Just heard the devastating news about legendary Shane Warne passing away. No words to describe how shocked & sad I am. What a legend. What a man. What a cricketer."

15.title: Ex-Army Chief General Sunith Francis Rodrigues passes away at 88
15.article_body: General (retd) Sunith Francis Rodrigues, who headed the Indian Army between 1990 and 1993, passed away at the age of 88 on Friday. "Known as a Thinker and Strategist, he leaves behind a legacy of utmost dedication and service to the Nation," an official statement said. Rodrigues had also served as the Governor of Punjab between 2004 and 2010.

16.title: The man who made spin cool is no more: Sehwag on Shane Warne's demise
16.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Virender Sehwag condoled the death of former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne, saying, "Cannot believe it. One of the greatest spinners, the man who made spin cool, superstar Shane Warne is no more." He added, "Life is very fragile, but this is very difficult to fathom. My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends and fans around the world."

17.title: Shane Warne condoled ex-Aus keeper Rod Marsh's demise in last tweet hours before death
17.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Shane Warne had condoled the demise of former Australian keeper Rod Marsh in his last tweet hours before his death. "Rod cared deeply about cricket & gave so much-especially to Australia & England players. Sending lots & lots of love to Ros & the family. RIP mate," he wrote. Warne passed away aged 52.

18.title: Israel can be potential ally if Palestinian conflict resolved: Saudi
18.article_body: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman has said, "We look at Israel as a potential ally but before that it should solve its problems with the Palestinians." Separately, he also said that Saudi Arabia intends to continue "detailed talks" with Iran in order to reach a satisfactory agreement for both. Saudi Arabia doesn't have diplomatic ties with Israel and Iran.

19.title: What weapons are being used by Russia in war with Ukraine?
19.article_body: Russian military has used warplanes, tanks, howitzers, Kalibr cruise missiles and Iskander missiles, which have a range of up to 500km, in Ukraine, according to AP. Ukrainian officials have accused Russia of using cluster bombs, rockets and artillery shells, which release "bomblets" that hit multiple targets. Ukraine also accused Russia of using thermobaric bombs that can vaporise targets.

20.title: Former Australia cricketer Shane Warne passes away aged 52 due to suspected heart attack
20.article_body: Former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne has passed away at the age of 52. Warne's management released a statement, saying that he passed away in Thailand due to a suspected heart attack. “Warne was found unresponsive in his villa and despite the best efforts of medical staff, he could not be revived,” the statement read.

21.title: Video shows PM playing 'damru' at Kashi Vishwanath Temple in UP
21.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday was seen playing a 'damru' at the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in his Lok Sabha constituency Varanasi, a video of which has surfaced. He also offered prayers at the temple. Earlier in the day, PM Modi held a roadshow in Varanasi ahead of the last phase of Assembly polls in Uttar Pradesh on March 7.

22.title: Couple gets married in Ukraine's bomb shelter amid Russian invasion
22.article_body: A couple in Ukraine tied the knot in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion of the country. A video of their ceremony showed the bride holding a bouquet of flowers while a guest held a traditional Ukrainian wedding bread. The couple also signed marriage documents while a group of people cheered around them.

23.title: Morphed pic claiming Salman married Sonakshi goes viral, actress says 'Are you so dumb?'
23.article_body: A morphed picture claiming to show actors Salman Khan and Sonakshi Sinha secretly getting married went viral recently. The actress, while reacting to it, called out people believing the picture to be genuine. "Are you so dumb that you can't tell the difference between a real and a morphed picture?????" she commented on an Instagram post along with laughing emojis.

24.title: Hyd Police to conduct 'Gender Equality run' to mark Women's Day
24.article_body: Hyderabad Police's She Team will be conducting a 'Gender Equality 2K & 5K Run' to celebrate International Women's Day. The event will be held at People's Plaza, Necklace Road in Hyderabad on Sunday from 5.30 am. Those who sign up for the event will be entitled to a t-shirt, finisher medal and post-run breakfast as part of the registration fee.

25.title: Shahid Kapoor buys newly launched Mercedes-Maybach S-Class worth ₹2.5 crore, pics surface
25.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has purchased the newly-launched Mercedes-Maybach S 580, pictures of which have surfaced online. He bought the car for ₹2.5 crore, said reports. Pictures of Shahid and his wife Mira Kapoor along with the car had surfaced on social media. Shahid reportedly purchased the new car as a 41st birthday present for himself.

26.title: Reassuring to see over 20,000 Indians have left Ukraine: Govt
26.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Friday informed that over 20,000 Indians have left war-hit Ukraine since advisories were issued. "There are more people, but it's reassuring to see that these many people have left Ukraine," spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. India launched Operation Ganga to bring back citizens stuck in Ukraine after Russia invaded its neighbour last week.

27.title: Govt defers DefExpo 2022 to be held in Guj over logistics problems
27.article_body: The Ministry of Defence said on Friday that the DefExpo 2022 which was scheduled to be held in Gujarat's Gandhinagar from March 10-14 has been postponed due to "logistics problems being experienced by participants". PM Narendra Modi was to inaugurate the event. Earlier, the ministry said that 973 exhibitors, including 121 foreign exhibitors from 63 countries, had registered.

28.title: Nawazuddin spoke of his struggling days, I felt I'm on right path: Surya
28.article_body: Actor Surya Sharma has said that when actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui told him about his struggling days, he realised that he is on the right path in his career. The actor added that he met Nawazuddin at an acting workshop during his own struggling days. Surya further said that he has learnt a lot from Nawazuddin.

29.title: In next 5yrs, India will be world's biggest film industry: Prabhas
29.article_body: Actor Prabhas has said that pan-India films have opened many doors, adding that in the next five years, India will be the biggest film industry in the world. "Hollywood has one language in which films are made and so is the case with Chinese or Korean films. But in India, we have films being made in several languages," Prabhas added.

30.title: Pak Prez Arif Alvi appears before court in 2014 PTV attack case
30.article_body: Pakistan President Arif Alvi on Friday appeared before an anti-terrorism court in the 2014 Pakistan Television Corporation and Parliament House attack case. Members of ruling Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party were involved in the attack. Alvi, who filed an application to decline availing Presidential immunity, said, "I appeared before the court today as a common citizen and not as the President."

31.title: Will pay for his treatment in Ukraine: Govt on Harjot who was shot at in Kyiv
31.article_body: The government of India will be bearing expenses for Harjot Singh's medical treatment in Ukraine, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Friday. "We're trying to ascertain his medical status...Our embassy is...trying to reach out but facing trouble as it's a conflict zone," said MEA spokesperson. Singh was shot at in Kyiv on February 27.

32.title: Meghan sued by half-sister over alleged false, malicious statements
32.article_body: Meghan Markle is being sued by her half-sister Samantha over her interview with Oprah Winfrey for allegedly making "false and malicious statements". Samantha stated that Meghan falsely claimed she raised herself from poverty and worked low-paying jobs to make ends meet. The lawsuit further stated that Meghan misled the public about her father's absence from her wedding with Prince Harry.

33.title: Let us evacuate our people, urge you to have local ceasefire: India to Russia & Ukraine
33.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Friday urged Russia and Ukraine "to have a local ceasefire at least so that we can evacuate our people, students". MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said that evacuation looks difficult without a ceasefire. This comes as government launched 'Operation Ganga' to evacuate all Indian nationals from Ukraine amid war.

34.title: Fan holds AP Dhillon song-inspired poster for Virat Kohli, pic goes viral
34.article_body: A picture of a fan holding a poster, inspired by AP Dhillon's song 'Excuses', in the stands during the first day of India-Sri Lanka Test in Mohali went viral. The poster dedicated to Virat Kohli read, "Kehndi hundi si 100 banade (She used to say 'Score a hundred')." Kohli got out for 45 runs off 76 deliveries in first innings.

35.title: Researchers discover world's oldest-ever stegosaurus fossil in China
35.article_body: Researchers from China, UK discovered world's oldest-ever stegosaurus fossil in China. Named Bashanosaurus primitivus, it lived 168 million years ago suggesting stegosaurus might have originated in Asia. With a length of 2.8 metres, Bashanosaurus had armour plates which were thicker, narrower than other stegosaurs but similar to those of first armoured dinosaurs that are over 20 million years old.

36.title: Man arrested for committing burglaries, possessing drugs in Hyd
36.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a man on charges of illegal possession of narcotic substances and committing burglaries. They have seized 1.2 kg marijuana, 10 ml of hashish oil, cash and other valuables worth a total of ₹3 lakh from him. The accused, Ahmed Pasha, was earlier involved in 19 burglary cases in Hyderabad, Cyberabad and Rachakonda, the DCP said.

37.title: Global food practices cause 21-37% greenhouse gas emissions: Report
37.article_body: Centre for Science and Environment's annual report stated that global food practices of 7.8 billion people account for 21-37% greenhouse gas emissions every year. The report further noted emissions from food system alone will cause earth to heat above the target of 1.5 degree Celsius. The report was released by Bhupender Yadav, Minister for Environment, Forest & Climate Change.

38.title: Sending charter plane after death doesn't matter: Indian shot at in Ukraine
38.article_body: Indian national Harjot Singh who was shot at in war-hit Ukraine has sought evacuation to India, saying, "It doesn't matter if you send a charter (plane) after death." He added, "God has given me a second life, I want to live it." Singh, who is from Delhi, said he hasn't received any support from the Indian embassy in Ukraine yet.

39.title: Our forces won't participate in Russia-Ukraine war: Belarus Prez
39.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Friday said Belarusian armed forces were not taking part and would not take part in Russia's military operation in Ukraine. He added he had a long and detailed telephonic conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday. This comes as a senior Belarusian military official said it has strengthened its air defences along the border.

40.title: UN human rights body sets up panel to monitor human rights in Ukraine
40.article_body: UN Human Rights Council on Friday set up a three-member panel to monitor human rights in Ukraine amid war with Russia. The council voted 32-2 to pass a resolution that was presented by many Western countries with 13 member states including China abstained from voting. Meanwhile, as per UN, over 1 million refugees fled Ukraine in just seven days.

41.title: Netflix pauses future Russian projects amid conflict with Ukraine
41.article_body: Streaming service Netflix has paused all future projects and acquisitions with Russia due to its military operations in Ukraine. Netflix had four Russian original projects in the pipeline including a crime thriller series which was shooting and has been postponed. Earlier Disney and Warner Bros announced that they will be pausing all theatrical releases in Russia.

42.title: 'Namma Clinics' to be set up in all wards of Bengaluru: CM Bommai
42.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru. Bommai said the clinics, which are reportedly similar to Delhi's Mohalla Clinics, will be established in all wards of Bengaluru. The services of detection of non-communicable diseases and referral for higher treatment to specialists will be provided in these clinics.

43.title: Google Maps, Tripadvisor disable adding new reviews for Russian businesses
43.article_body: Google has blocked users from adding reviews on Maps for places in Russia, Ukraine and Belarus. Tripadvisor has also blocked reviews for restaurants and hotels where people had started posting comments on the Russia-Ukraine conflict as reviews. Hacking group Anonymous had earlier asked users to leave messages about the situation in Ukraine in Google Maps reviews for Russian businesses.

44.title: K'taka CM allocates ₹1,000 crore to implement Mekedatu project
44.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 today, announced that ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for the implementation of the Mekedatu project. He said the Mekedatu Balancing Reservoir and Bengaluru Drinking Water Project will be implemented by getting a nod from the centre. This comes after the Congress concluded its Mekedatu padayatra on Thursday in Bengaluru.

45.title: Meghalaya becomes 9th state to withdraw general consent to CBI
45.article_body: Meghalaya has become the ninth Indian state to withdraw general consent given to CBI. Notably, BJP is a partner in the ruling coalition, led by CM Conrad Sangma. Terming it a normal procedure, Sangma said, "Anybody who comes in here, has to take consent." Mizoram was the first state to withdraw consent in 2015 when it was ruled by Congress.

46.title: I'm not getting into movies: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan
46.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's daughter Ira on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to hold an 'ask me anything' session. She later shared a story of her answers, one of which stated, "I'm not getting into movies." Ira has made her directorial debut in theatre. She helmed a play called 'Medea' in which the lead role was played by actress Hazel Keech.

47.title: Ex-German Chancellor Schroeder should resign from Russian firms: Scholz
47.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has called on former Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder to resign from his posts at Russian firms. Schroeder is said to be a long-time friend of Russian President Vladimir Putin and is currently the chairman of the supervisory board of the Russian state energy company Rosneft. Scholz added the ex-chancellor's ties with Russian companies were not private matters.

48.title: Ridiculous: Sunny on trolls saying she adopted daughter for publicity
48.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone has called the trolls who accused her of adopting her daughter for publicity ridiculous and childish. "I think that the person who wrote that is someone who is not a part of my daily life," the actress added. Sunny further said that 'grow up' is the thing she will say for the comments that were made.

49.title: African arrested at Mumbai airport for smuggling drugs worth ₹2 cr
49.article_body: A 43-year-old African citizen has been arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) for allegedly smuggling cocaine worth nearly ₹2.30 crore. Kaba Ibrahimaat was intercepted at the Mumbai airport by DRI officials following a tip-off. No drugs were found in his baggage, however, it later emerged that he had swallowed the contraband in pellet form.

50.title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee park to be built on 350-acre land in B'luru: Bommai
50.article_body: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced to set up an Atal Bihari Vajpayee park on a 350 acre land in the Jarakabande area of Bengaluru's Yelahanka to increase the city's green cover. The proposed park will be based on the model of Bengaluru's Lalbagh and Cubbon Park. Notably, Bommai has allocated ₹8,409 crore for Bengaluru's development.

51.title: Which nations supported Russia or abstained from UNHRC vote on Ukraine crisis?
51.article_body: The UN Human Rights Council has said it has decided to establish an independent commission of inquiry as a result of Russia's aggression against Ukraine after a vote. While Eritrea and Russian Federation voted against the formation of the commission, India, Armenia, Bolivia, Cameroon, China, Cuba, Gabon, Kazakhstan, Namibia, Pakistan, Sudan, Uzbekistan and Venezuela abstained from voting.

52.title: Russian lawmakers introduce jail terms for 'fake' news about military
52.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Friday passed legislation to impose fines and jail terms for spreading "fake" news about Russia's armed forces. The amendments have to be approved by Parliament's upper house before going to President Vladimir Putin to be signed into law. Russia's enemies have spread false information in an attempt to sow discord among Russian people, officials claimed.

53.title: Domestic help in Mumbai clicks indecent pics of minors, held
53.article_body: A 27-year-old domestic help in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly clicking pictures and videos of his employer's 13-year-old daughter and 11-year-old niece while they were changing clothes or bathing. According to police, the accused was caught after the 13-year-old came across the pictures while playing games on his phone. Police also found pictures of other minors on the device.

54.title: Fire at communications centre disrupts internet in Iran's capital
54.article_body: The Iranian Communications Ministry on Friday said that a fire at the main telecommunications building in Tehran disrupted internet services in Iran's capital and the nearby city of Karaj. The fire was caused by a malfunction in a power connection, it added. Notably, Iran has some of the strictest controls on internet access in the world.

55.title: Kareena, Alia don't shy away from any kind of cinema: Ananya
55.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has said that Kareena Kapoor and Alia Bhatt don't shy away from any kind of cinema, adding that they do a little bit of everything. "I don't think that there are any roles that they've done that...I could've done justice to," she added. Ananya further said that she is in awe of Kareena and Alia's off-screen personalities.

56.title: 'Grammys Global Spin' recognises Armaan Malik for his single 'You'
56.article_body: Singer Armaan Malik has been recognised by the 'Grammys Global Spin', a concert series produced by the Recording Academy, for his single 'You'. The singer has become the first Indian artist to feature on the series. Initiated in 2020, the Global Spin showcases acts from around the world in order to promote global music.

57.title: We won't back down: Wikipedia as Russia threatens to block over invasion article
57.article_body: The Wikimedia Foundation said it will "not back down" after Russia threatened to block Wikipedia's Russian-language site covering Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia had claimed the article contained "illegally distributed information" about deaths among Ukrainian civilians and Russian forces that entered Ukraine. "We stand by our mission to deliver free knowledge to the world," Wikimedia added.

58.title: Mom saw Aashram, said 'Haye haye, you did such a role?': Bobby Deol
58.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has revealed that his mother watched his series 'Aashram' and said, "Haye haye, tune aisa role kiya (You did such a role)?" Bobby further said that his father veteran actor Dharmendra couldn't bring himself to watch the series and told him, "Beta, main tujhe aise nahi dekh sakta (Son, I can't watch you like this)."

59.title: Don't become slave to the system: Shaan warns young singers
59.article_body: Singer Shaan has urged young singers to "not become a slave to the system" by giving in to the industry pressure. "In the long run, you are destroying yourself as an artiste. No one will take you seriously," Shaan said. The singer added there is a 'new pressure' of garnering 'higher views' online, however, the singers shouldn't lose their identity.

60.title: Rishabh Pant misses ton by 4 runs as India score 357/6 on Day 1 against Sri Lanka
60.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant missed his century by four runs as India scored 357/6 on Day 1 of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali. The 24-year-old scored 96 runs off 97 deliveries, including nine fours and four sixes, and was dismissed by pacer Suranga Lakmal. Virat Kohli, who is playing his 100th Test, got out for 45(76).

61.title: Wait for official announcement: Maker of 'Mriya' reacts to video of its damage
61.article_body: Days after the world's largest aircraft 'Mriya' was destroyed by the Russian forces in Ukraine, its manufacturer, Antonov, responded to a viral video allegedly showing the damage sustained by 'Mriya'. It wrote, "Until the AN-225 has been inspected by experts, we cannot report on the technical condition of the aircraft. Please wait for the official announcements about its condition."

62.title: Priyanka, Rahul Gandhi visit Kashi Vishwanath temple in Varanasi
62.article_body: Congress leaders Priyanka and Rahul Gandhi offered prayers at the Kashi Vishwanath temple in Varanasi on Friday. The brother-sister duo's visit comes ahead of the last phase of the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections in which Varanasi will go to polls. "Whenever I or Bhaiya (Rahul) come here, we visit the temple and take Baba's blessings," said Priyanka.

63.title: 2 men posing as passengers rob cab driver using toy gun in Delhi; held
63.article_body: Two men, including a civil defence volunteer, posed as passengers and looted a cab driver using a toy gun in Delhi. Police have now arrested both the accused and recovered a car, mobile and motorcycle from their possession. According to police, the accused would often hire cabs as passengers and then stop at a deserted place to rob the driver.

64.title: India abstains in UNHRC vote on establishing inquiry commission on Ukraine crisis
64.article_body: India has abstained in UN Human Rights Council vote on establishing independent commission of inquiry on Ukraine crisis. The Council has decided to urgently establish an independent international commission of inquiry as a result of Russia's aggression against Ukraine after securing 32 votes in favour while 2 countries voted 'No'. Thirteen countries, including India, abstained from voting.

65.title: Putin is playing with fire by attacking nuclear plant: UK Defence Secy
65.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said Russian President Vladimir Putin was "playing with fire" by attacking Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "We call upon the Russian President in the strongest possible terms to absolutely cease attacking sites such as that, it's incredibly dangerous," he added. Ukraine said the Russian military had seized the Zaporizhzhya plant after attacking it.

66.title: Leopard enters Meerut house, forest department comes to the rescue
66.article_body: A leopard was seen barging into a house located in the Pallavpuram area of Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The Forest Department immediately rushed to the spot. The wild cat also reportedly jumped onto the road and ran adrift while they were trying to divert it away from the house. Many residents were seen gathered at the spot, ANI reported.

67.title: Maha's 1st digital clock showing its real-time population installed in Pune
67.article_body: Maharashtra's first digital population clock that shows the state's real-time population, as well as the estimated population of India, was installed at the Gokhale Institute of Politics and Economics in Pune on Friday. The state already has a population clock but it shows only the real-time population of the country. Currently, four such population clocks are operational in the country.

68.title: Jason Momoa to play villain in 'Fast & Furious 10'
68.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa has confirmed that he'll play the antagonist in the 10th instalment of the 'Fast & Furious' franchise. "It's fun, I get to play the bad guy, which I haven't gotten to do for a while. Now, I get to be...bad boy. A very flamboyant bad boy," he said. The film is expected to release in May 2023.

69.title: Disappointed, keep football out of politics: Russian coach Chernyshov
69.article_body: Talking about FIFA suspending Russia from football competitions due to the military operation in Ukraine, Mohammedan Sporting's Russian manager Andrey Chernyshov said he is "very disappointed", adding that football should be kept out of politics. "Sportsmen have nothing to do with decisions of the country's leadership," stated Chernyshov. "I hope all sanctions...will be lifted," he said.

70.title: Ukraine to unveil NFTs to support its armed forces soon: Vice PM
70.article_body: The Ukrainian government will soon unveil NFTs to support its armed forces, its Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov announced on Twitter. "Every day there are more and more people willing to help Ukraine to fight back the aggression," he added. However, he added that the government has no plans to sell fungible tokens.

71.title: Nag Ashwin seeks Mahindra's help to build futuristic vehicles for film, Mahindra replies
71.article_body: Director Nag Ashwin, who's shooting 'Project K' starring Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan and Deepika Padukone,  sought Anand Mahindra's support in building futuristic vehicles for the movie. "How could we refuse an opportunity to help you envision the future of mobility?" Mahindra responded. "Chief of Global Product Development @Velu_Mahindra will...happily throw his weight behind you," he added.

72.title: Your lives were saved by Modiji's grace: Union Minister to Ukraine evacuees
72.article_body: A video has surfaced showing MoS for Defence Ajay Bhatt telling Indian students evacuated from Ukraine, "Your lives have been saved by (PM Narendra) Modiji's grace. Everything will be fine." The video that was widely circulated online showed Bhatt also telling the students to chant, "Bharat Mata ki jai! Mananiya Modiji Zindabad! (Victory to Bharat Mata! Long live Modiji!)"

73.title: Stop supplying products to Russia, be part of history: Ukraine Vice PM to Samsung
73.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written to Samsung Electronics CEO Jong Hee Han, appealing the company to temporarily stop supplying services and products to Russia. He also sought to limit access to Samsung Pay. "We want you to be part of history...I do believe you care about world's peace and will never support bloody authoritarian aggression," he wrote.

74.title: UN countries to create world's 1st treaty to fight plastic pollution
74.article_body: UN countries on Wednesday agreed to create world's first global treaty to fight plastic pollution across oceans, rivers and lands. "Today we wrote history. Plastic pollution has grown into an epidemic," said Espen Barth Eide, UN Environment Assembly President. Approved by 175 member countries, it is regarded as the most significant green deal since the 2015 Paris climate agreement.

75.title: NASA launches satellite for US agency to track weather activity
75.article_body: NASA on Tuesday launched the third in a series of weather satellites for US' National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to support weather forecasts for US' West Coast, Hawaii and Alaska. The launch was a part of GOES (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellites) program. As per NASA, the satellite will also track wildfires, flash floods, dust storms and landslides.

76.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass likely to be operational by Mar 31: Officials
76.article_body: The 750-metre-long Ashram underpass in Southeast Delhi will be operational on or before March 31, said officials. A senior PWD official said, "Work on the Ashram underpass is nearly done and...on target...[it'll] be completed by March-end." Notably, Ashram Chowk connects central and South Delhi with Noida and Faridabad areas and around 3 lakh vehicles cross the Ashram intersection every day.

77.title: Bihar medical college creates WhatsApp group for parents to 'discipline' students
77.article_body: The Patna Medical College Hospital (PMCH) in Bihar has created a WhatsApp group for parents to "discipline students and to check absenteeism", according to PMCH principal Vidyapati Choudhary. "Students bunking classes is a perennial problem. We want to inculcate a strong sense of discipline among our students," Vidyapati said. PMCH resumed physical classes for students from February 28.

78.title: Rajasthan's financial management better than that of Centre: CM Gehlot
78.article_body: Rajasthan's financial management is better than that of the Central government, CM Ashok Gehlot said. The state government has already fulfilled 85% of the previous budget announcements, he added. There were 581 announcements in the Budget 2022-23 of which 60 have already been approved, Gehlot further said. "We have fulfilled 70% of our poll manifesto promises too," he stated.

79.title: The Economist's cover features bleeding Ukrainian flag amid war with Russia
79.article_body: The cover of The Economist's upcoming edition featured the colours of the Ukrainian flag with blood emerging from it, without any headline or strapline. Sharing the cover on Instagram, The Economist wrote, "He (Putin) will not stop until he is stopped. When he escalates, the world must meet him." Earlier, TIME magazine's cover featured Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's quote.

80.title: South Korea relaxes social distancing amid record high COVID-19 cases
80.article_body: South Korea on Friday relaxed social distancing measures despite the country reporting over 2.6 lakh COVID-19 cases and 186 deaths in last 24 hours, the country's highest since the pandemic began. However, the curfew at restaurants, theatres, bars and other indoor establishments will be extended by one hour from Saturday, said Jeon Hae-cheol, Minister of the Interior and Safety.

81.title: Vihari has given Team India the same sense of calm as Pujara: Gavaskar
81.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Hanuma Vihari's 58 in the first innings of India's opening Test against Sri Lanka, Sunil Gavaskar said Vihari provided Team India the same sense of calm as Cheteshwar Pujara used to. "Vihari was impressive in South Africa where the pitches were far more difficult," added Gavaskar. Pujara has been dropped from Team India Test squad.

82.title: Tamil Nadu teacher arrested for sexual harassment after girl attempts suicide
82.article_body: A Class 11 girl student of a private school in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district attempted suicide following alleged sexual harassment by her school teacher. The accused was arrested after the girl filed a complaint. The girl told police that the teacher had been sending inappropriate messages to her and had asked her to spend time with him in the school.

83.title: Canada PM urges Russia to stop shelling at Ukraine's nuclear plant
83.article_body: Canada PM Justin Trudeau on Thursday urged Russia to immediately cease "unacceptable attacks" at and around Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant site. He also called on Russia to end all military activities in area and committed to continue engaging with partners and allies. Meanwhile, Ukrainian firefighters doused a blaze at Europe's biggest nuclear plant that was ignited due to Russian shelling.

84.title: NATO doesn't seek conflict with Russia, but alliance ready for it: US
84.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken on Friday said that NATO will defend all its allies and territory against a Russian attack. "Ours is a defensive alliance. We seek no conflict, but if conflict comes to us we are ready for it and we will defend every inch of NATO territory," Blinken added while condemning Russia's ongoing attack on Ukraine.

85.title: Rohit Sharma's reaction to Virat Kohli getting out goes viral
85.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma's reaction to Virat Kohli's dismissal in the first innings of the first Test against Sri Lanka has gone viral. Rohit appeared shocked at the dismissal and put his hands on the head. Kohli, who was clean bowled for 45(76), appeared to be frustrated after seeing the replay of his dismissal in the dressing room.

86.title: Angad Bedi to play male lead in 'The Great Indian Kitchen' remake: Report
86.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi will reportedly be playing the male lead in the Hindi remake of Malayalam film 'The Great Indian Kitchen'. "Angad will reprise the role played by Suraj Venjaramoodu in the original," Pinkvilla reported quoting a source as saying. Being produced by Harman Baweja and Vicky Bahri, the film will star Sanya Malhotra.

87.title: Picked up from directors at work: Kriti on her role in 'Bachchhan Paandey'
87.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon opened up about playing the role of a director in 'Bachchhan Paandey'. "As an actor...just by observing and looking around, you start understanding how the directors make their vision come alive," Kriti said. The actress added, "I have seen so many talented directors at work, it feels like it was...easier for me to pick from them."

88.title: Probe against student in Ukraine for absence from UP village head duties
88.article_body: A probe has been launched against a student stuck in Ukraine for being absent from her duties as head of Tera Pursauli village in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi. This comes after Vaishali Yadav's video seeking help from the Indian government went viral online. A panchayat official said that action will be taken against Yadav, who is studying MBBS in Ukraine.

89.title: PM Modi speaks to Bihar CM on Bhagalpur blast, condoles loss of lives
89.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar regarding the blast at an illegal firecracker factory in Bhagalpur and condoled the loss of lives. In a tweet, he informed that the administration is engaged in relief and rescue work and assured all possible assistance to the injured. PM Modi also wished the injured a speedy recovery.

90.title: Dashcam captures the moment airstrike reduces residential buildings to rubble in Ukraine
90.article_body: A car's dashcam video of a Russian airstrike reducing residential buildings in Ukraine's Chernihiv into rubble has surfaced online. The video shows that the car escaped getting bombed by a few metres. At least 33 civilians had been killed in the bombardment of a residential area in Chernihiv, according to reports.

91.title: PMC eases COVID-19 curbs; malls, restaurants, gyms to operate at 100% capacity
91.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced further relaxations in COVID-19 restrictions in the city, effective from Friday. Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said all shopping complexes, malls, cinema theatres, auditoriums, restaurants, bars, gyms, spas, swimming pools, religious places, tourist spots, entertainment parks etc can operate at 100% capacity and as per pre-COVID-19 timings.

92.title: Bappa remembers dad Bappi Lahiri, shares old video of him with his grandson
92.article_body: Bappa Lahiri took to Instagram to share a throwback video of his late father Bappi Lahiri. In the video, the musician is seen doing a 'jugalbandi' with his toddler grandson Krishh. "The greatest gift I ever had came from God, and I call him Daddy. Jugalbandi With #Krishh," Bappa captioned the post. Bappi passed away on February 15 in Mumbai.

93.title: Journalist held for spreading fake news about Cong in Chhattisgarh
93.article_body: A 38-year-old journalist was arrested on Thursday for allegedly spreading fake news about Congress leaders in Chhattisgarh, police said. The arrest was made based on a complaint filed by a person claiming to be a party worker. The journalist's news portal was also accused of "drawing a wedge among the leaders and office bearers of Congress", according to the FIR.

94.title: What is the importance of Zaporizhzhya, Ukraine's nuclear plant targeted by Russia?
94.article_body: Built between 1984 and 1995, Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhya is the largest nuclear power plant in Europe and the ninth-largest in the world. It has six reactors, each of them generating 950 MW and a total power output of 5,700 MW, which is enough energy for around four million houses. It's located about 200 km from Crimea, which Russia annexed in 2014.

95.title: Some Russians using crypto as lifeline now, ban would hurt them: Coinbase CEO
95.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong in a series of tweets said, "Some ordinary Russians are using crypto as a lifeline now that their currency has collapsed. Many of them likely oppose what their country is doing, and a ban would hurt them, too." However, he said if the US decides to impose a ban, Coinbase will follow those laws.

96.title: Old Stone Age culture from 40,000 years ago discovered in China
96.article_body: Remnants of an Old Stone Age culture from 40,000 years ago have been unearthed in China. Xiamabei, a well-preserved Palaeolithic site has been excavated by researchers in the Nihewan Basin of northern China. While they did not discover any human remains from the site, tiny, blade-like tools made from ochre, a stone rich in iron were found.

97.title: Big B was nervous before shoot of his 1st song, stayed awake all night: Anwar
97.article_body: On the 50th anniversary of 'Bombay to Goa', actor Anwar Ali recalled an anecdote from the film. He revealed that Amitabh Bachchan was "extremely nervous" the night before the shoot for his first-ever song. "Amitabh tossed and turned unable to sleep...Reassuring him...all would be fine, I fell off to sleep, but not Amitabh, who stayed awake all night," said Anwar.

98.title: Madness: Norway PM on Russia attacking Europe's largest nuclear power plant
98.article_body: Norway's PM Jonas Gahr Store said Russian shelling that led to a fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine was "in line with madness". Ukrainian officials said the fire has been extinguished and no radiation leaks have been detected. If there's a leak at Zaporizhzhia plant, "it'll take about 48 hours before it arrives in Norway", Store added.

99.title: Drug peddling racket being run from Ludhiana jail busted, 2 held
99.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) busted a drug peddling racket being run from Ludhiana Central Jail and arrested two persons on Wednesday. They recovered heroin weighing 975 gm from them. "The accused said they work for Raman Kumar...who is lodged at the...jail. Kumar would...strike deals from jail, after which he would direct them to deliver the consignment," STF said.

100.title: NSE invites applications for the role of CEO, seeks IPO experience
100.article_body: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) of India is inviting applications from candidates for the role of Managing Director and CEO. The exchange is seeking candidates having IPO (initial public offering) experience and a track record of strengthening corporate governance. The NSE's current Managing Director and CEO Vikram Limaye's five-year tenure is set to end in July 2022.

101.title: Aware of farmers' issues: Pankaj Tripathi on investing in 'Krishi Network' app
101.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, who has invested an undisclosed sum in agritech app 'Krishi Network', said having "being raised in an agriculturally rich household", he is aware of the kind of problems that farmers face. He added, lack of information is the root cause of such problems. The actor has also been named the brand ambassador of the app.

102.title: Magic of movies now 100%: Alia on 100% capacity in Maha cinemas
102.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt on Thursday took to Instagram to welcome the decision of reopening cinemas in Maharashtra with 100% occupancy for the first time since COVID-19, writing, "The magic of movies is now 100%." The actress also posted a still from her film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Maharashtra on Wednesday allowed restaurants and theatres to function at 100% capacity in 14 districts.

103.title: Man sexually assaults 16-yr-old girl repeatedly, impregnates her in Pune
103.article_body: Pune Police has booked a man for sexually assaulting the 16-year-old daughter of his neighbour. According to police, the accused once gave the girl chocolate laced with sedatives and sexually assaulted her when she was unconscious and later committed the crime repeatedly. The incident reportedly came to light after the girl's parents found out that she was four months pregnant.

104.title: Rocket space junk travelling at 8,850 km/hr to hit Moon today, cause huge crater
104.article_body: A four-tonne rocket body will crash into the Moon on Friday, marking the first time that space junk is accidentally hitting lunar surface. It'll smash into a crater at a speed of 8,850 km/hr and create a crater of its own. The rocket booster, believed to be part of China's Chang'e 5-T1 mission, is expected to slam at 12.25pm GMT.

105.title: Angad is asked about his projects, I'm asked about our kids: Neha
105.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia has revealed that she went for an event with her husband actor Angad Bedi where he was asked about his next projects. "Then they looked at me and they were like, 'Aap yahan hain toh bachho ka dhyaan kaun rakh raha hai (If you are here then who is taking care of your children)?'" the actress said.

106.title: Aman Lekhi resigns as Additional Solicitor General
106.article_body: Additional Solicitor General (ASG) of India, Aman Lekhi, tendered his resignation from the post on Friday. In his resignation letter, addressed to the Union law and justice minister Kiren Rijiju, Lekhi wrote, "Tendering my resignation...at the Supreme Court with immediate effect." The senior advocate was appointed, in March 2018, after his name was cleared by the Union Cabinet.

107.title: US Navy recovers crashed F-35 fighter jet from South China Sea
107.article_body: An F-35C Lightning II aircraft that crashed while attempting to land on an aircraft carrier in South China Sea has been recovered by US Navy. The aircraft was conducting "routine flight operations" when it crashed on January 24, it said. The recovery alleviates concerns that China or Russia might reach it first and gain access to its technology, AP reported.

108.title: Suriya once said what I'm doing is not acting, just managing it: Rana
108.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati at a pre-release event for actor Suriya's upcoming Tamil film 'Etharkkum Thunindhavan' revealed that the latter told him 10 years ago that what he is doing is not acting, just managing it. "He took me in his car all over Hyderabad for four hours...His four-hour class made me Bhallaladeva, Daniel Shekar and many others," Rana said.

109.title: Calls for NATO no-fly zone in Ukraine irresponsible: Lithuania PM
109.article_body: Lithuanian PM Ingrida Simonyte said that any calls for NATO to enforce a no-fly zone in Ukraine would be "irresponsible" and could drag the military alliance into direct conflict with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been calling for NATO and Western allies to enforce a no-fly zone over Ukraine amid Russia's ongoing invasion and aerial bombardment of its cities.

110.title: Reddit bans users from sharing links to Russia-backed RT & Sputnik
110.article_body: Reddit has banned users globally from posting links to Russian state-sponsored media outlets, including RT and Sputnik. It has also decided not to accept ads that target Russia or originate from any Russia-based entity, government or private. A Reddit admin reportedly confirmed that Reddit is blocking links to all websites that end in .ru.

111.title: Delhi HC creates 3 more courts to expedite trials of pending UAPA cases
111.article_body: Delhi High Court has created three new Additional Sessions Judge (ASJ) courts to expedite trials of pending Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) cases. It has decided to withdraw the pending cases from the designated National Investigation Agency (NIA) courts. This comes after five Courts of Metropolitan Magistrate (NI Act) were shifted to Rouse Avenue Court Complex in January.

112.title: Himachal govt lowers age limit for pension to 60 yrs; amount hiked to ₹1,500
112.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, while presenting the Budget for 2022-23 in the state Assembly on Friday, announced that the monthly old-age pension amount will be increased from ₹1,001 to ₹1,500. Thakur also announced that the age limit will also be decreased from 70 years to 60 years for availing the pension, without any income limit.

113.title: Gautam Budh Nagar DM orders probe in alleged admission scam in Navodaya school
113.article_body: The Gautam Budh Nagar district magistrate has ordered an inquiry into the alleged fraud in admissions to Class 6 of the district's lone Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya. The central government school, located in a village in Dadri, is accused of enrolling students belonging to other districts. The inquiry will be led by the school's principal and whistleblower Anil Kumar Mishra.

114.title: Fan rightly predicts Kohli's score, way of getting out in 100th Test; tweet goes viral
114.article_body: A tweet has gone viral on social media wherein a fan rightly predicted that Virat Kohli will score 45 runs in the 100th Test. The fan, in the tweet, also correctly predicted how Kohli will get out to Sri Lanka's Lasith Embuldeniya. Reacting to the tweet, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Wow." Another user wrote, "How can someone be so accurate?"

115.title: We're not obsessed with wealth, it's boring: World's richest man Musk's brother
115.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk said in an interview that he and his brother aren't obsessed with wealth. "I do know other people...are obsessed with wealth...And that's not me...it's not my brother. It's boring," he added. Kimbal claimed Musk has "paid more taxes than any human on the planet in the history of America".

116.title: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl to make his acting debut
116.article_body: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl is set to make his acting debut. Confirming the development, he said, "Yes, I have shot for something. I'm going to share the details once I get a go-ahead from my producers. It's under post-production for now. Please keep me in your prayers." According to reports, Rohman has been taking acting workshops since 2017.

117.title: Rajesh Patil to be Administrator of Pune's PCMC from March 14
117.article_body: Maharashtra government has issued an order appointing Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Commissioner Rajesh Patil as the Administrator of PCMC from March 14, after the term of the present civic general body comes to an end on March 13. Patil will have sole authority to make policy and financial decisions. Patil's appointment was also in response to the delay of civic body elections.

118.title: Ukrainian President survives 3 assassination attempts in 1 week: Report
118.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has survived three assassination attempts since the Russian invasion began last week, a report said. It added that two different groups, the Wagner Group and Chechen rebels, were sent to kill Zelenskyy. Earlier, Ukrainian official Oleksiy Danilov said Russia's Federal Security Service alerted them about Chechen special forces sent to kill Zelenskyy.

119.title: BharatPe removes Ashneer Grover's profile from its website days after his exit
119.article_body: Days after his resignation as the MD and director, BharatPe has removed Ashneer Grover’s profile and photo from its website. In a statement, the company had accused Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain of misappropriating company funds to fund their lavish lifestyle. The 'About Us' page now features Co-Founder Shashvat Nakrani, CEO Suhail Sameer, Nishit Sharma, among others.

120.title: You will see me on OTT very soon: 'Mohabbatein' star Preeti Jhangiani
120.article_body: Actress Preeti Jhangiani, known for films like 'Mohabbatein' and 'Awara Paagal Deewana', said the audience will soon get to see her on an OTT platform. The actress pointed out the lack of interesting projects as her reason for absence from the industry. "I got selective and nothing great in terms of characters was coming my way," Preeti added.

121.title: Last thing you want is to create uncertainty: Hesson on coaching Kohli
121.article_body: RCB's Director of Cricket and former head coach Mike Hesson said the last thing you want to do while coaching batters like Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers is "create uncertainty" around techniques or anything else. "If you see something that's...not...right, you just observe for a while and then...ask questions because these players are great for a reason," added Hesson.

122.title: 30 people killed, 56 injured in a bomb blast at Pakistan mosque during Friday prayer
122.article_body: At least 30 people were killed and 56 others injured in a bomb blast inside a mosque in Pakistan's Peshawar on Friday, police said. "We are in a state of emergency and the injured are being shifted to the hospital. We are investigating the nature of the blast but it seemed to be a suicide attack," a police officer said.

123.title: B'luru court orders Apple to refund ₹92,000 to man for not fixing iPhone
123.article_body: Bengaluru consumer court has ordered Apple India and its service centre to give a man a new iPhone or refund equivalent money, i.e, ₹92,000, for allegedly refusing to repair his iPhone, which was under warranty. It observed the parties failed to repair the device of a genuine customer. It also ordered them to pay ₹20,000 as compensation to the man.

124.title: Kim Kardashian drops surname 'West' after being declared legally single
124.article_body: American media personality Kim Kardashian has dropped the surname 'West' after she was declared legally single amid her divorce with rapper Ye, formerly known as Kanye West. Kim, who married Ye nearly eight years ago, had recently filed documents to be declared single. She had filed for divorce last year in February.

125.title: Vladimir Putin is at risk of ending up in prison for war crimes: UK on Ukraine war
125.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is at risk of ending up in prison for war crimes carried out by his forces in Ukraine, Deputy Prime Minister of the UK Dominic Raab has said. An investigation by the International Criminal Court (ICC) is currently underway, with officials reportedly already in Ukraine probing whether war crimes have been carried out there.

126.title: FIR filed against UP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son for 'hisab kitab' remark
126.article_body: An FIR has been registered against UP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son Abbas Ansari for his 'hisab kitab' remark. "I've told Akhilesh Yadav that no transfers...of government officials will happen for six months as 'hisab kitab' will happen with them first if Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party-Samajwadi Party alliance wins," Abbas had said. Abbas is contesting UP Assembly elections from Mau Sadar.

127.title: Never been prouder to be Ukrainian: Mila on Russia-Ukraine conflict
127.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis and her husband actor Ashton Kutcher have released a video on Instagram in which the actress said, "I have never been more proud to be a Ukrainian." "And I've never been more proud to be married to a Ukrainian," Ashton added. Mila also urged fans to help raise funds for refugees fleeing Ukraine amid the Russian invasion.

128.title: Randeep Hooda's knee surgery successful: Report
128.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda's knee surgery after sustaining an injury on the sets of his upcoming series 'Inspector Avinash' has been completed successfully, reported Free Press Journal. The actor had been shooting for an action sequence with his co-star Amit Sial. Randeep had reportedly hurt the same knee earlier while shooting 2021 film 'Radhe' which starred Salman Khan.

129.title: UP constable carries elderly woman to poll booth in his arms, video goes viral
129.article_body: Video showing a policeman carrying an elderly woman to a polling booth in his arms has gone viral online. Identified as Pawan Kumar, the policeman is posted as a constable in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur. Calling Kumar a true watchdog of democracy, UP Police tweeted they are proud of him for helping the woman cast her vote at Assembly Elections.

130.title: Don't expect Paine to play cricket in 2022: Tasmania interim coach
130.article_body: Discussing former Australia Test captain Tim Paine who is on an indefinite break from cricket following a 'sexting' scandal, interim Tasmania Tigers head coach Ali De Winter said he doesn't expect Paine to play in 2022. "Paine's obviously shattered with what's happened. His life has changed," former Australia head coach Justin Langer had earlier said.

131.title: Underwater noise pollution may cause hearing loss in turtles: Scientists
131.article_body: Underwater noise pollution caused due to shipping and offshore construction may lead to hearing loss in turtles, scientists have warned. This hearing loss can last from a few minutes to days. "Over half of turtle and tortoise species are threatened, and noise pollution is an additional stressor to consider as we work towards protecting these animals," researcher Andria Salas said.

132.title: Russian news channel staff resigns on air, walks off after saying 'no war'
132.article_body: Independent Russian television channel TV Rain suspended its operations after being asked to shut operations by authorities over its coverage of Ukraine's invasion. A video showed the staff resigning on air and walking off, after saying, "No war." The channel then played 'Swan Lake' ballet video which was also played on all Soviet channels in 1991 during the civil unrest.

133.title: Renault shares fall to lowest since Nov 2020 amid Russia-Ukraine war
133.article_body: The price of shares of French automaker Renault has fallen since last week to trade at their lowest since November 2020, amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It has reportedly lost around a quarter of its market value after the Russian invasion and growing sanctions. Renault, which owns a majority stake in Russian automaker Avtovaz, is monitoring the situation in Ukraine.

134.title: BSF rescues 23 cattle in Assam from being smuggled to Bangladesh
134.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) rescued 23 cattle from NH-6 at Hilara area in Assam's Cachar district on Thursday. The cattle were meant to be smuggled to Bangladesh, BSF said in a statement. Recently, Director-General of BSF, Pankaj Kumar Singh, had also informed that the forces are using technologically advanced devices to stop livestock smuggling along the India-Bangladesh border.

135.title: Omicron found in 100% of COVID-19 samples in Mumbai in latest genome sequencing
135.article_body: As per the latest round of genome sequencing carried out by the BMC, Omicron variant was found in 100% of the COVID-19 samples tested from Mumbai. Of the 237 patients, 103 or 44% were unvaccinated, BMC's report states. "There is nothing to panic about. But we should continue to adhere to COVID-19-appropriate behaviour," BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani said.

136.title: NATO must change posture after Russia's invasion of Ukraine: Romania
136.article_body: Romanian Foreign Minister Bogdan Aurescu on Friday said that NATO must adapt military posture at its eastern flank to a new reality following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Romania will increase its defence spending to 2.5% from 2% of GDP starting with the next fiscal year, he added. Aurescu also mentioned the presence of Russian troops in Belarus.

137.title: Russia-backed media outlet RT America shuts down, fires most of its staff
137.article_body: Russia-backed media outlet RT America is shutting down operations and laying off most of its employees, CNN reported. T&R Productions, the production company behind RT America, attributed the decision to "cease production" to "unforeseen business interruption events" in a memo to its staff. Earlier, satellite operator DirecTV stopped carrying RT America in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine.

138.title: Denial of physical relationship in marriage is cruelty: HC while granting divorce
138.article_body: Chhattisgarh High Court has held that denial of physical relationship by one spouse to the other in a matrimonial relationship amounts to cruelty. The court allowed the plea for divorce made by the husband in this case. "Physical relationship between husband and wife is one of the important parts for healthy married life," the court stated.

139.title: Over 1.67 lakh Ukrainians entered Romania since Russian invasion
139.article_body: More than 1.67 lakh Ukrainians have crossed the Ukraine-Romania border since Russia invaded the country on February 24, border police data showed on Friday. About 1,09,687 of those have already driven or flown out of Romania. The people entered Romania through its four land border checkpoints with Ukraine and also through its checkpoints with Moldova, the data showed.

140.title: Russia planning public executions in Ukraine after cities are captured: Report
140.article_body: Russia's intelligence agency, Federal Security Service, is planning public executions in conquered Ukrainian cities in order to shatter morale, according to a European intelligence official. "[It] is also planning violent crowd control and repressive detention of protest organisers," reports said while citing Bloomberg. Russia has seized Europe's largest nuclear power plant situated in Ukraine.

141.title: Virat Kohli recalls old photo with Rahul Dravid during speech, pic goes viral
141.article_body: The old photograph with Rahul Dravid that Virat Kohli mentioned in his speech while being felicitated for his 100th Test match has gone viral. "I still have the picture in my house from my Under-15 NCA days, when I was looking at you. Today...I get my 100th Test cap from you...so indeed it has been a great journey," Kohli said.

142.title: Who is Sanjiv Kapoor, the new CEO of Jet Airways?
142.article_body: Sanjiv Kapoor, who reportedly resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels this week, will join Jet Airways as its new CEO on April 4. Kapoor, a Wharton School MBA graduate, started his airline career with Northwest Airlines in the US in 1997. He was SpiceJet's COO between 2013 and 2015 and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer between 2016 and 2019.

143.title: The only way to end Ukraine war is to assassinate Putin: US politician
143.article_body: US politician Lindsey Graham has called for the assassination of Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Russia-Ukraine war and said, "The only way this ends is for somebody in Russia to take this guy out." "Is there a Brutus in Russia? Is there a more successful Colonel Stauffenberg in the Russian military," he tweeted.

144.title: Pak court says Jadhav has right to fair trial, asks India to appoint lawyer
144.article_body: Pakistan's Islamabad High Court on Thursday observed that former Indian Navy officer Kulbhushan Jadhav is a human being and cannot be denied the right to a fair trial, reported Pakistan daily Dawn. The court has also asked India to appoint a lawyer for him by April 13. Jadhav was sentenced to death by a Pakistani military court in 2017.

145.title: Updating software to power Starlink via car cigarette lighters: Musk to Ukraine Vice PM
145.article_body: Responding to Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov, Elon Musk said SpaceX's Starlink is getting an update to reduce peak power consumption, so it can be powered from car cigarette lighters. Mobile roaming also activated to maintain a signal even while in a moving vehicle, Musk added. Fedorov had sought ideas from Musk to keep Starlink services online amid Russian invasion.

146.title: Aamir Khan told me that I must do 'Jhund': Amitabh Bachchan
146.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that when he discussed 'Jhund' with actor Aamir Khan, the latter said that he must do the film. "And you know what happens when Aamir endorses something," the veteran actor added. Aamir had earlier called 'Jhund' one of Amitabh Bachchan's greatest films, saying that it breaks everything he has learnt in 20-30 years.

147.title: West Indies take 3 wickets in last over, defeat New Zealand in Women's World Cup opener
147.article_body: West Indies defeated hosts New Zealand by three runs in 2022 Women's World Cup opener in Mount Maunganui. West Indies put up a total of 259/9 before dismissing New Zealand for 256 runs in 49.5 overs. West Indies took three wickets in last over. This is the first time that West Indies won a women's international match in New Zealand.

148.title: Happiest day of my life: Seema shares pics from son Mayank's wedding to Sanah
148.article_body: Actress Seema Bhargava Pahwa took to Instagram to share pictures from her son Mayank Pahwa's wedding with actress Sanah Kapur, daughter of Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak. "Happiest day in my life. God bless you both...feel proud to announce my son MAYANK PAHWA & SANAH KAPUR got married so so happy," she wrote. Mayank and Sanah got married on Wednesday.

149.title: US waives COVID-19 tests for Americans leaving Russia, Belarus
149.article_body: The US State Department said the country is waiving a requirement for negative COVID-19 tests from Americans leaving Belarus or Russia to travel home. "This exercise of enforcement discretion is limited to US citizens, permanent residents, and holders of valid immigrant visas who were in either country as of February 28," the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said.

150.title: Coinbase, Binance not to ban all Russians from platforms
150.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchanges Coinbase and Binance have said that they have no plans to preemptively ban all Russians from using their platforms. "We believe everyone deserves access to basic financial services unless the law says otherwise," Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said. "We are not going to unilaterally freeze millions of innocent users' accounts," Binance said.

151.title: DU to begin centenary celebration from May 1, several initiatives planned
151.article_body: The Delhi University is going to kickstart its centenary celebrations from May 1, Vice-Chancellor Yogesh Singh said. The celebrations will begin with the release of a commemorative stamp followed by other initiatives including the release of documentary films highlighting the university's history. "We will also felicitate our distinguished alumni including the unsung heroes of DU," said Singh.

152.title: Building owner arrested for death of 4 while cleaning septic tank in Pune
152.article_body: Pune Police have arrested the owner of a residential building over the death of four people after inhaling toxic gases while cleaning a septic tank. The arrest was made based on the complaint of a deceased's wife. She alleged that her husband, a watchman, was forced to enter the tank by the building owner.

153.title: 8 people can fit in place of a dead body on flight: BJP MLA on student's body in Ukraine
153.article_body: After 21-year-old student Naveen died in shelling in Ukraine, Karnataka BJP MLA Arvind Bellad said, "More space is needed to bring a dead body on flight. In the place required for a dead body, eight persons could be accommodated and brought back." "The government is putting in effort to bring back the mortal remains of Naveen," he added.

154.title: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' to release on Eid 2023
154.article_body: Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' is set to release in theatres on Eid next year. The film, directed by Maneesh Sharma and produced by Aditya Chopra, will hit the screens on April 21. The makers also unveiled the first teaser of the action film on Friday. Salman will also make a cameo appearance in Shah Rukh Khan's 'Pathaan'.

155.title: Rajasthan CM accuses Centre of withholding funds, seeks state BJP's support
155.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has accused the BJP-led Centre of reducing the subsidy on several schemes leading to a financial burden on the state. CM Gehlot urged the state unit of BJP, which is in Opposition in Rajasthan, to take up the matter and has even proposed to send an all-party delegation from the state to New Delhi.

156.title: Paytm ex-execs' kids-focussed fintech startup Junio raises $6 mn
156.article_body: Children-focussed fintech platform Junio has raised $6 million in a funding round led by UAE-based firm NB Ventures with participation from Rajiv Dadlani Group. Founded by Shankar Nath and Ankit Gera, former senior executives of Paytm, Junio's product is a children-focussed smart card that lets them make digital and physical purchases. Junio raised $2 million in seed funding last year.

157.title: Russian soldier holding grenades walks on street in Ukraine demanding surrender
157.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed a Russian soldier walking through a crowd in a Ukrainian street, holding two grenades, purportedly demanding them to surrender. The crowd shouted "shame" as the soldier made his way through them. It was alleged that the soldier was said to be in the city to negotiate Ukrainian surrender with the citizens.

158.title: Security forces seize explosive materials in Jharkhand's Gumla district
158.article_body: Security forces on Wednesday seized explosive materials from a forest in Gumla district of Jharkhand, a police official said. A special team comprising of district armed police and the CRPF launched a combing operation after receiving a tip-off that a Maoist had allegedly stored explosives. Officials seized 24 pieces of gelatin and 10 kg of ammonium nitrate.

159.title: Leave Ukraine or we'll f**k you up: Group claims hacking Russian space research site
159.article_body: Cybercriminals linked to Anonymous hacking group claimed to have broken into Russia's Space Research Institute's (IKI) website and leaked files allegedly belonging to the Russian space agency Roscosmos. "Leave Ukraine alone else Anonymous will f**k you up even more," the hackers wrote. Earlier, Russia denied another Anonymous-linked group's claim of disabling Russian satellite control systems.

160.title: Romanian mayor gets into verbal fight with Scindia amid students' evacuation
160.article_body: A video shows a Romanian mayor getting into a verbal spat with Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia during evacuation of Indian students who arrived from Ukraine. In the video, the mayor can be heard telling Scindia, "Explain to them (the students) when they will leave home. I provide the shelter, I provide the food and I helped them, not you."

161.title: Delhi court fines CBI ₹10,000 for not answering query in bank fraud case
161.article_body: A Delhi court has fined CBI ₹10,000 for not answering its query related to a bank fraud case. "CBI's approach is actually disappointing...They cannot ignore court's directions on the basis of their own sweet will," the court said. The case pertains to M/S Alpine Realtech Pvt Ltd and others booked on allegations that it had cheated Punjab and Sind Bank.

162.title: I found him shrewd, charismatic: Harsh Goenka on meeting Vladimir Putin years ago
162.article_body: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Harsh Goenka, the Chairman of RPG Enterprises, took to Twitter to recall that he met Russian President Vladimir Putin several years ago. "I found him shrewd, calm, charismatic and nationalistic. They say that the face becomes the mirror of the mind," he wrote. His tweet included an artwork showing Putin with fangs, surrounded by houseflies.

163.title: 6 barge into rented accommodation, thrash 3 women for wearing shorts in Pune
163.article_body: Six persons have been booked for allegedly barging into a rented accommodation in Pune and thrashing three women with footwear for wearing shorts. The accused also allegedly abused the complainant, who is the owner of the house, and threatened to demolish her house. The complainant alleged the accused were angry because the women wore shorts and roamed in the locality.

164.title: Stop support of SAP products till Russian tanks attack Ukraine: Vice PM to SAP
164.article_body: Ukrainian Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has asked Germany-based software firm SAP to stop support of its products in Russia instead of just stopping its sales. "We ask you to stop support of SAP products, as long as Russian tanks and missiles attack Ukraine!" he said. "Bloody invader's army continues to kill our civil population," Fedorov added.

165.title: NHRC issues notices as 4 die while cleaning septic tank in Pune
165.article_body: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Friday issued notices to the Maharashtra Chief Secretary and Pune City Police Commissioner after four people allegedly died while cleaning a septic tank at a residential building in the city. "It is completely unwarranted that the poor people die for their livelihood due to lackadaisical attitude on the part of the authorities," NHRC said.

166.title: 4 booked, official suspended over destruction of rocks in Hyd's Khajaguda Hills
166.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly destroying rock formations in Hyderabad's Khajaguda and also encroaching the area. Six security guards have been placed in the area to prevent further encroachment and the responsible Village Revenue Assistant has been suspended. This comes in response to an ongoing campaign by activists and heritage enthusiasts against encroachment of Khajaguda Hills.

167.title: Virat Kohli becomes 6th Indian batter to score 8,000 runs in Test cricket
167.article_body: Virat Kohli has become sixth Indian batter to score 8,000 runs in Test cricket. The 33-year-old reached the 8,000-run mark after scoring his 38th run in first innings of first Test against Sri Lanka, which marks his 100th Test. Other Indians to score at least 8,000 Test runs are Sunil Gavaskar, Sachin Tendulkar, Rahul Dravid, VVS Laxman and Virender Sehwag.

168.title: Barca Prez Laporta told me 1000 times Xavi won't be the manager: Koeman
168.article_body: Former Barcelona head coach Ronald Koeman said the club's President Joan Laporta told him a "1000 times" that Xavi would not be the team's manager as he "lacked" experience. "I still find it painful. I was not Laporta's coach. I had that feeling from the first moment after the elections there was no connection between us," added Koeman.

169.title: Greenfield airport to be set up in Arunachal Pradesh’s Hollongi
169.article_body: The Airport Authority of India has undertaken the construction of a Greenfield Airport in Hollongi, 15 Kms from Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar. With eight check-in counters, the terminal will be able to accommodate 200 passengers during peak hours, a press release by the Ministry of Civil Aviation stated. The energy-efficient building will also be provisioned with a Rain Water Harvesting system.

170.title: I'm seeking your trust again: Macron announces re-election bid
170.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday announced that he's standing for re-election. "I'm seeking your trust again. I'm a candidate to invent with you, faced with the century's challenges, a French and European singular response,'' he said in a letter to French people. If Macron succeeds, he'll be the first French President in 20 years to win a second term.

171.title: Chelsea's owner Abramovich helped pick Putin’s 1st cabinet: Piers Morgan
171.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, British broadcaster Piers Morgan tweeted, "Memo to Chelsea fans...justifying their defence of Abramovich...: he literally helped pick Vladimir Putin's first cabinet." "That's why he won't criticise Putin," added Morgan in his tweet. "Abramovich is one of Putin's closest advisers," Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier said.

172.title: I had no chance: Eoin Morgan on going unsold in IPL mega auction
172.article_body: Having scored 133 runs in 17 matches for KKR in IPL 2021, Eoin Morgan admitted he had "no chance" after the first round in the IPL mega auction, despite leading KKR to the edition's final. "It's a fact that I have not scored enough runs," said Morgan. "I am never grateful for hard lessons," added the English cricketer.

173.title: I can only think about Chelsea with Russian owner Abramovich: Tuchel
