173.article_body: Reacting to Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich's decision to sell Chelsea having bought the club in 2003, manager Thomas Tuchel said he can only think about Chelsea with Abramovich, adding that it's "very hard" for him. "It hasn't sunk in yet that this is going to stop," stated Tuchel. "Every decision he takes is the right decision," he said.

174.title: Virat Kohli has developed India's bowling strength: Gautam Gambhir
174.article_body: Talking about former Team India captain Virat Kohli, Gautam Gambhir said Kohli has "developed" India's bowling strength, adding that bowlers win you matches and batters "only" set the match up. "If you talk about Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, you have experienced players like Hanuma Vihari and Shreyas Iyer who can replace them," stated Gambhir.

175.title: Cyberpunk 2077 video game maker halts all sales to Russia & Belarus
175.article_body: Poland-based developer of video game Cyberpunk 2077, CD PROJEKT RED, is halting all sales of its products to Russia and Belarus. "The entire CD PROJEKT Group stands firm with the people of Ukraine," it said. "We do believe that commercial entities, when united, have the power to inspire global change in the hearts and minds of ordinary people," it added.

176.title: I wouldn't be the person I am if it wasn't for Rodney Marsh: Watson
176.article_body: Reacting to ex-Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh's demise, Shane Watson tweeted, "I wouldn't be the person I am...if it wasn't for Rod...[He had an] amazing skill to know how to get the best out of every young cricketer." "I am absolutely shattered," added Watson in his tweet. "Australia has lost a cricketing icon and legend," read a tweet from Aaron Finch.

177.title: Petition submitted to Karnataka CM to reduce Bengaluru bus fare
177.article_body: Advocacy group Bengaluru Bus Prayanikara Vedike has submitted a petition to Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai and Transport Minister B Sriramulu for reducing bus fares and providing free service to women, transgenders and senior citizens. The petition sought ₹1,000 crore/year for Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) for this. BMTC fares are highest among all Indian cities, it claimed.

178.title: Nearly 1,000 primary schools for girls shut down in 5 years in Guj
178.article_body: As per the Socio-Economic Review report 2021-'22, around 1,000 primary schools for girls were shut down in the past five years in Gujarat. The number dropped to 1,330 in 2020-'21 from 1,429 in 2016-'17. Moreover, the enrolment of girls in primary schools slipped from 41.98 lakh to 39.80 lakh during this period.

179.title: Europe's largest nuclear power plant seized by Russian military, claims Ukraine
179.article_body: The Russian military has seized Europe's largest nuclear power plant Zaporizhzhya NPP in Ukraine, State Nuclear Regulatory Inspectorate of Ukraine said in a statement. "Operational personnel are monitoring the condition of power units," it added. Russian forces had attacked the plant on Friday morning, setting an adjacent five-storey training facility on fire.

180.title: Elon Musk warns Starlink could be 'targeted' in Ukraine, shares ways to keep caution
180.article_body: Days after SpaceX activated Starlink satellite broadband service in Ukraine, CEO Elon Musk warned there's a high probability of it being targeted amid Russia's invasion. "Starlink's the only non-Russian communications system still working in...parts of Ukraine...Please use with caution," he wrote. "Turn on Starlink only when needed and place antenna...as far away from people as possible," he said.

181.title: Ex-Pune Police Commissioner gets relief from arrest in phone tapping case till Mar 25
181.article_body: Bombay High Court on Friday granted relief from arrest to former Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla till March 25. She has filed a plea before the court seeking cancellation of the FIR against her. Police had registered an FIR against Shukla in connection with the alleged phone tapping of Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole during the previous BJP-led Maharashtra government.

182.title: Every 8th individual in India suffers from glaucoma: PGIMER doctors
182.article_body: Every eighth individual of almost 138 crore people in India suffers from or is at risk of developing glaucoma, doctors from Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER) said on Thursday. "Glaucoma is characterised by damage to the optic nerve leading to irreversible blindness," Dr Surinder S Pandav from PGIMER said. It commonly affects people aged above 40.

183.title: Amitabh has presented my emotions perfectly: Vijay Barse on 'Jhund'
183.article_body: Vijay Barse, the man who started Slum Soccer in India, has said his "favourite actor" Amitabh Bachchan has presented his emotions perfectly in the film 'Jhund'. "It was...great experience to see Amitabh as myself on screen...I realised many times that the way he expressed Vijay Barse was exactly what I felt at that particular moment of my life," he added.

184.title: Debris falling from mountains crushes 3 U'khand women; body of 1 woman found
184.article_body: Three women were crushed by debris that fell from mountains in the Luthiyag village of Uttarakhand. The body of one of the women has been taken out, Rudraprayag District Magistrate said. Search for the two other women is underway. The victims had gone to collect gravel and concrete when the accident took place, as per reports.

185.title: US may impose sanctions on India: US diplomat as India abstains from UN vote on Russia
185.article_body: Top US diplomat Donald Lu has said that the US administration was still considering sanctions against India over the purchase of a missile defence system from Russia. His comments came after India abstained from a vote on the UN General Assembly (UNGA) resolution to condemn the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Further, Lu described India as an important security partner.

186.title: What's the big deal: Neelam on receiving botox treatment on 'Fabulous Lives...'
186.article_body: Neelam Kothari, when asked if she was comfortable getting filmed while receiving botox treatment on show 'Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives', said, "I...feel...people make such a big deal of botox and...all these procedures...and I just feel 'what's the big deal?'" "You're gonna age one day and you're gonna do stuff to make yourself feel good and look good," Neelam added.

187.title: Maid held in Hyd for robbing elderly woman after blinding her with Harpic
187.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Wednesday arrested a caretaker for allegedly blinding a 73-year-old woman with Harpic and Zandu Balm and robbing her. Accused P Bhargavi was appointed as caretaker by the victim's son and had been living with her since August 2021. After applying the poisonous solution, Bhargavi robbed the victim of ₹40,000, two gold bangles and other valuables, police said.

188.title: Aviation veteran Sanjiv Kapoor appointed Jet Airways CEO
188.article_body: The Kalrock Capital and Murari Lal Jalan consortium, Jet Airways' new promoters, has appointed Sanjiv Kapoor as CEO of the airline. Kapoor, who was previously SpiceJet's Chief Operating Officer and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer, resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels on Thursday. "By having Sanjiv as CEO...I'm certain Jet Airways will reclaim its lost glory," Jalan said.

189.title: Airbnb is suspending all operations in Russia and Belarus: CEO
189.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has revealed that the firm is suspending all operations in Russia and Belarus amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine. This comes days after Chesky had said US sanctions on Russian banks had affected its ability to operate within the country.  Airbnb will provide free short-term housing for up to one lakh refugees fleeing Ukraine.

190.title: 60-yr-old K'taka man enters mosque, threatens to kill religious leader; held
190.article_body: Police have arrested a 60-year-old man for allegedly trespassing into a mosque in Karnataka's Mangaluru and threatening to kill the religious leader there. A knife was seized from the two-wheeler vehicle he came in, police said. So far, it remains unclear why he threatened to kill the religious leader and more details will be available after further questioning, police added.

191.title: Russia blocks access to BBC's website, Facebook, Google Play: Report
191.article_body: The BBC's website appeared to be blocked in Russia as reports said there were problems accessing the website, hours after it brought back shortwave radio technology to cover the Russia-Ukraine war. BBC Russia's Twitter account claimed that Facebook parent Meta, Google Play Store and German public broadcaster Deutsche Welle also appeared to be blocked in Russia.

192.title: Nuclear reactors being shut down at Ukraine power plant after Russia attack: US
192.article_body: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm has said the reactors at Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant are being safely shut down, adding that they are protected by robust containment structures. Granholm tweeted that she spoke with Ukraine's energy minister about the situation at the plant, where a fire broke out during fighting between Russian and Ukrainian forces.

193.title: Man held for killing partner in Gurugram 4 yrs after he killed her husband
193.article_body: Police arrested a 42-year-old woman's live-in partner for allegedly strangling her to death, two days after she was found dead at her house in Gurugram. The accused also confessed to murdering her husband in 2018, police said. The woman and accused had been in a relationship since 2014 and in 2018, her husband became aware of their affair, police added.

194.title: Putin's actions threaten Europe's safety: UK PM after nuclear plant fire
194.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of endangering all of Europe after Russian troops attacked Europe's biggest nuclear power plant in Ukraine and sparked a fire. Johnson said that he would seek an emergency UN Security Council meeting in the coming hours over Putin's "reckless actions". The fire at Zaporizhzhia nuclear power station has been extinguished.

195.title: Who have played the most Test matches for India?
195.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli today became the 12th Indian to feature in at least 100 Test matches. Sachin Tendulkar has played the most Test matches for India (200). He is followed by Rahul Dravid (163) and VVS Laxman (134). The current BCCI President Sourav Ganguly represented India in 113 Test matches.

196.title: Ex-Australia keeper Rodney Marsh dies aged 74, seven days after suffering heart attack
196.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh passed away aged 74, seven days after suffering a heart attack in Queensland. He had effected 355 dismissals in Test cricket, a world record at the time of his retirement. He was also the first Australian wicketkeeper to score a Test century. He is survived by wife Roslyn and sons Daniel, Paul and Jamie.

197.title: Ali Fazal exits 'Fukrey 3' due to scheduling issues: Reports
197.article_body: Ali Fazal, who was set to star in 'Fukrey 3', has reportedly exited the project due to scheduling issues. The actor is currently shooting for Vishal Bhardwaj's 'Khufiya' and will be "busy with the thriller till March-end", a source told Mid-Day. 'Fukrey 3', starring Pulkit Samrat, Varun Sharma, Manjot Singh and Richa Chadha, went on floors on Wednesday.

198.title: Class 3 girl allegedly raped by teacher, school manager in UP
198.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her teacher and the school manager in Muzaffarnagar on Thursday. On returning home, the class 3 student narrated the incident to her father who then immediately lodged a police complaint. Circle Officer Kuldeep Singh said that the two accused have been arrested under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

199.title: Every household should develop its own solar tree in coming years: PM
199.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that every household in India should develop its own solar tree that can contribute to saving up to 15% of electricity. "It'll not only be unique but will be environment-friendly," he added. "In the coming years, India's energy demands will increase, therefore, we must transition to renewable energy," PM stated.

200.title: Pune man strangles wife to death on suspicion of affair; arrested
200.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested in Pune on Thursday for allegedly beating and strangling his 35-year-old wife to death. The incident reportedly occurred a day before during a fight over the man's suspicion that the deceased was having an extramarital affair, according to the police. The deceased's body was sent for post mortem at Sassoon General Hospital.

201.title: Mumbai's Digha Railway Station likely to be operational by November this year
201.article_body: Around 70% of the work of Mumbai's Digha Railway Station has been completed and authorities expect to make it operational by November this year, said Ravi Agarwal, Chairman and MD, Mumbai Rail Vikas Corporation (MRVC). The station is being built under Phase-1 of the Mumbai Urban Transport Project (MUTP) 3. It will reportedly help decongest the Thane station.

202.title: 5 arrested as B'luru police bust extortion racket; ₹1.6 lakh seized
202.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested four home guards and a man posing as a journalist for allegedly running an extortion racket. The police have also recovered about ₹1.6 lakh. The home guards reportedly would enter a spa and accuse its owner of running a prostitution racket, following which the false journalist would threaten to publish the news, a police officer said.

203.title: 92% COVID-19 deaths during third wave among unvaccinated: Govt
203.article_body: During the third COVID-19 wave, 92% of the deaths were reported among those who were unvaccinated, Director-General of Indian Council of Medical Research Dr Balram Bhargava said. "This is data from three databases with more than 94 crore population," he added. "The Indian graph is very much lower than the other countries, many of them developed countries," Bhargava further said.

204.title: Russian embassy road in Lithuania to be named 'Ukrainian Heroes Street'
204.article_body: The Lithuanian capital will name the road leading up to the Russian embassy "Ukrainian Heroes Street", Vilnius Mayor said. "Everyone who writes to the embassy will have to give a thought to the victims of the Russian aggression and about the heroes of Ukraine," Remigijus Simasius added. The city council will adopt the change on Wednesday, the mayor said.

205.title: 60-yr-old woman tries to set herself on fire outside Mantralaya in Mumbai
205.article_body: A 60-year-old woman poured kerosene on herself and tried setting herself ablaze outside the Mantralaya in Mumbai. The woman alleged that she had been framed by police in a case and demanded action against the concerned police officer. She further asked to cancel the FIR filed against her in the case.

206.title: Some contract staff stuck in Ukraine: US EV infrastructure firm CEO
206.article_body: US EV infrastructure firm ChargePoint CEO Pasquale Romano has said that around 20 of the firm's contract employees are stuck in Ukraine amid the ongoing war. He said the employees are not able to flee after the Ukrainian government banned men of ages 18 to 60 years old from leaving. He added ChargePoint is searching for ways to help them.

207.title: Singer Aditya Narayan, Shweta Agarwal blessed with a baby girl
207.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan and his actress-wife Shweta Agarwal have been blessed with a baby girl. Aditya has revealed that their daughter was born on February 24. "I have already started singing songs to her. Music is in her DNA," he added. "Shweta and I feel extremely blessed that we are parents now," he added.

208.title: Analyst toasts to 'death' of Russian stock market on TV, says 'Rest in peace, comrade'
208.article_body: With Russian stock market being closed for four straight days after the country's invasion of Ukraine, stock exchange analyst Alexander Butmanov made a "funeral" toast to the stock market live on a business TV channel. "Dear stock market, you were close to us and interesting. Rest in peace, dear comrade," he said as he opened a bottle of soda water.

209.title: Security camera video shows fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine
209.article_body: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, took to Twitter to share a security camera video of fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Zaporizhzhia NPP is under fire! The entire Europe is at risk of a repeat of the nuclear catastrophe. Russians must stop fire!" he wrote.

210.title: TN proposes to send MPs, officials to countries adjoining Ukraine
210.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has proposed to send four lawmakers and four IAS officers to Romania, Poland, Hungary and Slovakia, countries that adjoin Ukraine, for evacuating over 1,000 Tamil students. State CM MK Stalin has sent the list of the team to Union Minister S Jaishankar for approval. "So far, about 193 students from Tamil Nadu have been facilitated," Stalin said.

211.title: Fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine extinguished
211.article_body: The fire caused by Russian shelling at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine has been extinguished, emergency services said. Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he has informed the leaders of the US, Britain, the European Union and the International Atomic Energy Agency about the threat of nuclear disaster after Russian troops shelled the nuclear power plant.

212.title: 8.5 kg heroin worth ₹60 crore seized from 2 Kenyan nationals at Guj airport
212.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has arrested two Kenyan nationals with 8.5 kilograms of heroin worth ₹60 crore at the Ahmedabad Airport in Gujarat. According to officials, the accused had hidden the narcotics in cavities inside their bags. "These passengers came to visit India on the pretext of medical visits on the basis of fabricated letters," DRI's statement said.

213.title: UK freezes assets of Russian billionaire & ex-deputy PM, imposes travel ban on them
213.article_body: The UK government has announced new immediate sanctions on two Russian oligarchs, which include a full asset freeze and travel bans. The two oligarchs are Arsenal FC's former billionaire shareholder Alisher Usmanov and Russia's former deputy PM Igor Shuvalov. "Putin associates [are] now cut off from their significant UK interests including mansions worth tens of millions," the government said.

214.title: Twitter to reopen all offices from March 15, staff can pick work from home 'forever'
214.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Twitter will reopen all its offices around the world from March 15 after nearly two years. However, he added that employees can work wherever they feel the most "productive and creative" and that includes "working from home full-time forever". They can also choose to work some days in office and some days at home.

215.title: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 16,200 amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
215.article_body: The Sensex tanked more than 1,050 points on Friday amid weak global cues due to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The Sensex was trading below 54,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell around 320 points to trade below 16,200. Banks and auto stocks, Maruti Suzuki and Axis Bank, were among worst-hit during intraday trade.

216.title: HC seeks info from UP on meat sale ban in Mathura-Vrindavan wards
216.article_body: Allahabad High Court has sought information from Uttar Pradesh government over the ban on sale of meat and other non-vegetarian items in 22 wards under the Mathura-Vrindavan municipal corporation while hearing a petition. Last year, a state government order had declared these wards as "holy pilgrimage" sites. The petition asked the court to direct authorities not to restrict their businesses.

217.title: Allow firefighters access to Ukraine nuclear site: Biden to Russia
217.article_body: US President Joe Biden spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy after a fire broke out at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine after Russian shelling, the White House said in a statement. "Biden joined President Zelenskyy in urging Russia to cease its military activities in the area and allow firefighters, emergency responders to access the site," the statement read.

218.title: Dad didn't want me to join film industry, hid an offer for months: Neelam
218.article_body: Actress and jewellery designer Neelam Kothari has revealed that her parents were not initially comfortable with her decision to forge a career in acting. "We didn't have...filmy background," she said, adding, "So I got [an] offer, but I think for months...dad didn't tell me. Because in their head it was a big capital 'NO', our daughter is never joining films."

219.title: Evacuation from Ukraine accelerating, 7,400 more Indians to return in 2 days: MEA
219.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has said the pace of India's evacuation operation from war-hit Ukraine is accelerating and around 6,400 people have been brought back under Operation Ganga so far. Over 7,400 more Indians are expected to return home over next two days, it added. Eighteen flights have been scheduled in the next 24 hours, MEA spokesperson said.

220.title: Sitaram Yechury accuses Cong of 'flirting with soft Hindutva'
220.article_body: CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury has accused Congress of "flirting with soft Hindutva" and calls it "weakened" to take on the BJP at the national level. Speaking to the press in Kochi, Yechury said, "Congress has played in tandem with the BJP against the state's LDF government." He further claimed, "A stronger Left will bring all secular forces together."

221.title: Won't allow any polls till OBC quota is restored in local bodies: Maha Min
221.article_body: Leader of the Opposition in Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Devendra Fadnavis said that BJP will not allow any elections in the state until OBC reservation is restored in all local bodies. "The Maha Vikas Aghadi government's lackadaisical approach towards the OBC reservation is shocking," he added. "It has miserably failed to safeguard the OBC reservation," Fadnavis further said.

222.title: Pete Davidson close to joining Bezos on spaceflight this yr: Report
222.article_body: US comedian Pete Davidson is close to signing a deal to join Blue Origin's Jeff Bezos on a spaceflight later this year, The New York Post reported. "They haven't signed a contract yet, but it looks like it's going to happen," a source was quoted as saying. "Star Trek" actor William Shatner rode on a Blue Origin spaceflight last October.

223.title: Around 46,750 people live on Yamuna floodplains in Delhi: Report
223.article_body: About 9,350 households with roughly 46,750 people in 56 bastis reside on the Zone O floodplains of Yamuna in Delhi, a report stated. While more than half of these people practice farming, others earn their livelihood through fishing, nurseries, daily wage labour. The report studied the floodplains along a stretch of 22 km of the river in the national capital.

224.title: Men’s lifestyle brand DaMENSCH raises ₹122.5 crore in Series B funding
224.article_body: Bengaluru-based men's fashion startup DaMENSCH has raised ₹122.5 crore in a Series B round of funding from A91 Partners. The company had previously raised ₹50 crore in Series A in November 2020. Founded by Anurag Saboo and Gaurav Pushkar, DaMENSCH aims to create premium essential wear for modern men who seek excellence in everything they do, including their apparel.

225.title: Newly appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner clears transfer of 128 officers
225.article_body: Sanjay Pandey, who was appointed as Mumbai Police Commissioner on Monday, released 128 police officers due for transfer. Pandey had ordered the transfer of around 187 police officers while he was the state's acting Director General of Police (DGP). However, they were not relieved earlier as former Police Commissioner Hemant Nagrale opposed the transfer citing less manpower in the city.

226.title: India reports 6,396 COVID-19 cases, 201 deaths in last 24 hours
226.article_body: India has reported 6,396 new COVID-19 cases and 201 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,561 cases and 142 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 69,897, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,14,589.

227.title: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Juventus lie more than Putin: La Liga Prez
227.article_body: La Liga President Javier Tebas said Barcelona, Real Madrid and Juventus "lie more than" Vladimir Putin, adding that the clubs want to "kill" football. "They constantly say [the European Super League]...won't affect national leagues. All the national leagues must be idiots, dumb because all of us will say it will hurt us," stated Tebas.

228.title: Kohli likes to get under the skin of bowlers like Miandad: Gavaskar
228.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, Sunil Gavaskar said Kohli likes to get under the "skin" of bowlers like ex-Pakistani cricketer Javed Miandad, adding that he is one of the rare batters who likes to sledge bowlers. "To provoke a fast bowler takes something else," stated Gavaskar. The first India-Sri Lanka Test marks Kohli's 100th Test match.

229.title: 5 private firm officials killed after car rams into truck in Bilaspur
229.article_body: Five officials of a private firm died on the spot after their car allegedly rammed into a truck on National Highway- 48 in Bilaspur on Thursday. The deceased were going for dinner after celebrating a birthday party, police said. They worked at different positions in a logistics company that provides logistical support in the supply chain to e-commerce firms.

230.title: If nuclear power plant explodes, that will be end for Europe: Ukraine President
230.article_body: After Russian troops shelled Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "If there is an explosion – that's the...end for Europe." "Do not allow death of Europe from a catastrophe at a nuclear power station," he added. Earlier, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted that fire has broken out at the plant.

231.title: Mamata killer of democracy, supports Rohingya Muslims: Union Min
231.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh on Thursday reacted to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee being shown black flags amid chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' in Varanasi, saying, "Why..people of Uttar Pradesh won't be angry with her? She always supports Rohingya Muslims and terrorists." He added that Mamata is a "killer of democracy".  'Jai Shri Ram' chants "irritate" Mamata, he further said.

232.title: At least 7 dead, several injured in explosion at house in Bihar's Bhagalpur
232.article_body: At least seven persons died and several others were injured in an explosion at a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur on Thursday late night, police said. "Prima facie, it is coming to light that the family was involved in making firecrackers. Around two to three houses were damaged," Bhagalpur DM said. The injured persons were admitted to a local government hospital.

233.title: US imposes full blocking sanctions against Putin's spokesperson, 7 Russian elites
233.article_body: The US announced new full blocking sanctions against seven Russian elites and President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov, calling him a "top purveyor of Putin's propaganda". It also imposed visa restrictions on 19 oligarchs and their families. One of Russia's richest men Alisher Usmanov's property has been blocked from use in US, including his superyacht, which Germany seized recently.

234.title: Virat Kohli felicitated at start of his 100th Test, Anushka Sharma attends ceremony
234.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli was felicitated at the start of the first India-Sri Lanka Test in Mohali, which marks his 100th Test match. Team India head coach Rahul Dravid presented Kohli with a special cap to mark the occasion, while Kohli's actress-wife Anushka Sharma attended the ceremony. Kohli is the 12th Indian to feature in 100 Test matches.

235.title: Heroin worth ₹6 cr extracted from woman's body over 12 days in Rajasthan
235.article_body: As many as 88 capsules containing 862 grams of heroin worth ₹6 crore were extracted from a woman's body at a hospital in Rajasthan over a period of 12 days, officials said. The woman, a Sudan national, had swallowed some capsules and concealed others in her private parts. She had arrived at Jaipur airport from UAE's Sharjah on February 19.

236.title: Prabhas says he feels uncomfortable doing kissing scenes and removing shirt
236.article_body: Actor Prabhas, who will next be seen in the romantic-drama 'Radhe Shyam', said in an interview that he's not comfortable in filming intimate scenes for his movies. "I get uncomfortable with kissing scenes and removing my shirt," he said. "I check how many people are there on sets and say let's go and do somewhere else," Prabhas further said.

237.title: Saudi Crown Prince offers war mediation in call with Putin
237.article_body: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, during a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday, offered to make efforts to mediate talks between Moscow and Kyiv as Russia continues its invasion of Ukraine. The Saudi leader also reiterated his support for the OPEC group of oil producers, which includes Russia, to stabilise oil markets, state media reported.

238.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 3 in fake medical registration certificates scam
238.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday busted a fake medical registration certificate scam and arrested three persons. According to police, two of the accused, who completed their MBBS from China, had planned to get the certificates illegally after failing the screening test in India. They were helped by a state medical council staff, who charged ₹9 lakh for each certificate, police added.

239.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st Test against Sri Lanka
239.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first in first Test against Sri Lanka at the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association Stadium in Mohali. India's playing XI features Hanuma Vihari, Jayant Yadav and Mohammad Shami. Virat Kohli is featuring in his 100th Test, while Rohit is leading India in a Test for the first time.

240.title: Google suspends all ad sales in Russia amid invasion of Ukraine
240.article_body: Google announced that it has suspended all ad sales in Russia, a ban that covers search, YouTube and outside publishing partners, amid Ukraine's invasion citing "extraordinary circumstances". "The situation is evolving quickly, and we will continue to share updates," it said. Earlier, Russia had reportedly told Google not to show YouTube ads with "false political information" about Ukraine.

241.title: 2 held for assaulting 40-yr-old man to death in Delhi's Sadar Bazar
241.article_body: Police arrested two suspects after a 40-year-old man was assaulted to death by three men in Delhi's Sadar Bazar. The prime suspect is absconding and is suspected to have fled to his native place in Nepal, police said. "The prime suspect was enraged with the victim and his family...they had assaulted him and his father over a quarrel," police added.

242.title: 2 farmers booked for planting banned opium poppies in farmland in Pune
242.article_body: Pune Rural Police has booked two farmers from Indapur for allegedly planting banned opium poppies in their farmland. According to police, the accused had illegally planted banned opium poppies in between groundnut and garlic plants in their farmlands. Police seized 1,100 opium poppy plants worth around ₹2.11 lakh from the farmlands during a raid.

243.title: He has refused to stop attacks on Ukraine: Macron after call with Putin
243.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said that he spoke to Russian President Vladimir Putin over the phone, and he has "refused to stop his attacks on Ukraine at this point". "It is vital to maintain dialogue to avoid human tragedy. I will continue my efforts and contacts. We must avoid the worst," Macron said in a Twitter post.

244.title: 4 women rescued as Pune police bust sex racket; 1 arrested
244.article_body: Pune City Police have rescued four women, including an Uzbekistan national, as they busted an alleged sex racket, a press release said on Thursday. A 28-year-old purported agent has been arrested by the police. The police team had set a trap in Sakore Nagar following a tip-off and arrested the accused who'd arrived there with the women in an autorickshaw.

245.title: 3 students from Nashik drown at Palghar beach while trying to save 13-yr-old boy
245.article_body: Three college students from Nashik, all aged 17 years, drowned while trying to save a 13-year-old boy at Kelwa beach in Palghar, police said. The students had come to the beach for a picnic. The 13-year-old boy also drowned in the incident. Another student, who was also pulled in by strong currents of the sea, was saved by local fishermen.

246.title: Indian student shot at in Ukraine: Union Minister VK Singh
246.article_body: Union Minister VK Singh told ANI, "I received information that an [Indian] student coming from Ukraine's Kyiv was shot at and was taken back midway." "We're trying for maximum evacuation with minimum loss," he further said. Earlier, a 21-year-old Indian student named Naveen Shekharappa was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv.

247.title: Ukraine Foreign Minister shares pic of 9-storey residential building after missile attack
247.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has shared a picture of a completely burnt nine-floor apartment building in Borodyanka, Kyiv after it was destroyed following a missile attack by Russia. He tweeted, "Each time when Russian liars say they don’t drop bombs on Ukrainian cities...show this photo...Russians bombed the town for two days...killing many civilians. Stop barbaric Russia now."

248.title: Indian news anchor shouts at wrong guest on live TV for 2 minutes, video goes viral
248.article_body: A video of a news channel's debate on Ukraine crisis went viral after the anchor shouted at a guest for two minutes before realising he was shouting at the wrong person. Mistaking Ukrainian panellist Bohdan Nahaylo as American panellist Daniel McAdams, the anchor said, "Don't lecture us Mr McAdams." Moments later, McAdams said, "I'm Mr McAdams...so stop yelling at me!"

249.title: UK's richest woman Denise Coates earns $400 million in a year from her betting company
249.article_body: Denise Coates, the 54-year-old Founder and CEO of Bet365, received £300 million ($400 million) in pay and dividends in a year despite a salary cut, according to a filing by the online bookmaker. The UK's richest woman has earned more than $1.8 billion over the past decade, according to Bloomberg. Her salary makes her one of the world's best-compensated bosses.

250.title: K'taka HC bans protests, rallies in B'luru except at Freedom Park
250.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Thursday directed the state government to ensure that no protests or processions take place in Bengaluru except at Freedom Park. This comes after Congress' Mekedatu Padayatra caused traffic disruption in the city for the past few days. "It took us one hour to get to...High Court. How're regular people supposed to get around?" the bench said.

251.title: AAP MLA from Delhi sustains serious injuries in road accident in UP
251.article_body: An Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Delhi, Akhilesh Pati Tripathi, on Thursday sustained serious injuries in a road accident in Uttar Pradesh, the party said. His car overturned on the Lucknow-Agra Expressway in Unnao while he was returning from the Assembly poll campaigning. Tripathi, an MLA from Delhi's Model Town, was rushed to a hospital in Lucknow for treatment.

252.title: Fire breaks out at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine after Russia attack
252.article_body: Russian shelling has led to a fire at Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Russian army is firing from all sides upon Zaporizhzhia NPP...If it blows up, it will be 10 times larger than Chernobyl! Russians must immediately cease the fire, allow firefighters, establish a security zone," Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted.

253.title: I'm no good at networking: Sushmita Sen on not getting Bollywood roles
253.article_body: Sushmita Sen in a recent interaction with film critic Sucharita Tyagi, talked about her absence from acting for almost 10 years. Speaking about how she found it hard to get roles upon her return, the actor said, mainstream Bollywood wasn't offering her what she wanted. "Maybe I wasn't putting myself out there...I am no good at networking," she added.

254.title: 45-year-old man arrested for raping street dog in Mumbai
254.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested by the Ambernath Police in Mumbai on Thursday for allegedly raping a street dog. "The incident was witnessed by a social worker and a family staying near the accused. They saw the dog in a bad condition and took it immediately to a hospital," a police official said, adding that the dog is stable.

255.title: 7-yr-old girl out to play sexually assaulted by 23-yr-old man in Pune
255.article_body: A 23-year-old man allegedly sexually assaulted a seven-year-old girl while she was playing near a bus stand in Pune. An investigation revealed that the man forcibly took the girl to the corner of the bus stand and allegedly assaulted her. "The people in the area caught him, when the girl raised an alarm," a police official was quoted as saying.

256.title: Mumbai man breaks traffic police's e-challan machine after being fined
256.article_body: A 26-year-old two-wheeler rider allegedly broke the e-challan machine of traffic police in Mumbai. A policeman had reportedly penalised him for jumping signal, following which he snatched the machine from his hands and threw it on the ground and fled away. However, he was later arrested and presented before the court, which remanded him to police custody for two days.

257.title: Can't promote drunkenness: Delhi govt on order stopping discount on liquor
257.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that the national capital "couldn't become a city for promoting drunkenness through discounts on liquor." The giving of discounts by liquor vends was an attempt by a few to "monopolise" the whole system, it added. It comes as private liquor sellers challenged Delhi government's order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol.

258.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians
258.article_body: Following the second round of negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, Russia has agreed on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians, a Ukrainian official said. "Unfortunately, the results Ukraine needs are not yet achieved," tweeted Ukraine's presidential advisor Mykhailo Podolyak. The other key issues on the agenda were immediate ceasefire and armistice.

259.title: 19 COVID-19 cases reported at German football club FSV Mainz 05
259.article_body: German club FSV Mainz 05 on Thursday said there were 19 confirmed COVID-19 cases amongst the first-team, including players, coaches and staff. Mainz said everyone involved in the first-team is "completely immunised", adding Thursday's team training session was cancelled and players who tested negative trained individually. Mainz's Bundesliga match on Sunday against Borussia Dortmund is in doubt.

260.title: Mumbai RPF's crime prevention team nabs 2 robbers; seizes phone, cash
260.article_body: The crime prevention team of RPF Central Railway Mumbai division nabbed two robbers on Tuesday. The incident happened at the railway yard of LTT when both accused beat up a passenger and tried to escape after robbing him of cash, his phone and charger. The two accused, Ganesh Telange, 23, and Ganesh Kewat, 18, accepted their crime during preliminary investigation.

261.title: Told mother I'll think about marriage after Baahubali: Prabhas
261.article_body: Actor Prabhas, while talking about his work and family, said that his family has been pressurising him to "get married and have kids". The 42-year-old further said that he'd told his mother he'll think about marriage after his  film 'Baahubali'. He shared that while he too wishes to settle down, he feels that "it'll happen at the right time".

262.title: Actor Randeep Hooda gets hurt during shoot, undergoes knee surgery
262.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda on Wednesday underwent knee surgery at a Mumbai hospital after sustaining an injury on the set of his upcoming series 'Inspector Avinash'. The actor reportedly suffered the injury while filming a combat sequence for the series in February. A source close to the actor informed that he hurt the same knee he had injured while filming 'Radhe'.

263.title: 2 Tripura students return from Ukraine, felicitated by CM Biplab Deb
263.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Thursday met with two students who reached the state safely from Ukraine. The CM felicitated both the students and thanked PM Narendra Modi for his efforts to evacuate Indian students from Ukraine. Responding to questions regarding the number of Tripura students stuck in Ukraine, the CM said that exact figures weren't available.

264.title: Tens of millions of lives at risk in Ukraine: UN Human Rights Chief
264.article_body: The UN Human Rights Chief Michelle Bachelet on Thursday said tens of millions of lives are at risk in Ukraine as Russia continues its invasion of the country, which began last week. Ukraine's First Deputy Foreign Minister Emine Dzhaparova said Russian troops fighting in Ukraine "systematically engage in acts that clearly amount to war crimes and crimes against humanity".

265.title: 'I don't bite,' says Ukraine President as he asks Putin to 'sit down' for negotiation
265.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has asked his Russian counterpart Putin to "sit down" for negotiation amid the ongoing war between both the countries. "I don't bite. What are you afraid of?" Zelenskyy further said. "Words are more important than shots," he added while stating that it was sensible to have talks.

266.title: It was nice to meet you, jokes Pak's Fakhar as fan shares 'long distance' selfie
266.article_body: Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman took to Twitter to react to a 'long distance' selfie taken by a fan from the stands during a Pakistan Super League match. In the picture, Fakhar is not clearly visible as he was near the boundary rope. Commenting on the picture, Fakhar wrote, "It was nice to meet you."

267.title: 249 civilians dead, 553 injured in Ukraine: UN Human Rights Office
267.article_body: The UN Human Rights Office on Thursday said it has confirmed that 249 civilians have died and 553 have been injured in Ukraine since Russia's invasion began last week. However, Ukraine's emergency service on Wednesday said over 2,000 civilians have been killed so far. The UN Human Rights Office added it believes the true death toll is "considerably higher".

268.title: Sit down with me, just not at 30 metres: Ukraine President to Russia's Putin
268.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday called for Russian President Vladimir Putin to "sit down" with him for negotiation. "Sit down with me to negotiate, just not at 30 metres," Zelenskyy said. Reports said he was apparently referring to recent photos of Putin sitting at one end of an extremely long table when he met with French President Emmanuel Macron.

269.title: Rahul shares video of student criticising govt on return from Ukraine
269.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday shared a video of an Indian female student who criticised the government's evacuation process from Ukraine. Rahul said evacuation is a duty and not a favour. "We are brought back on a flight from Romania, which is a safe country. So how can you call this evacuation?" the student had said in the video.

270.title: 34-yr-old kills his father in Goa for rejecting marriage proposals
270.article_body: A 34-year-old man killed his father in Goa after blaming him for rejecting marriage proposals. The accused, identified as Rajesh Gaonkar, attacked his 65-year-old father Ganesh Gaonkar with an iron rod. Police said the murder's cause was understood to be constant bickering with his father over marriage and his father not letting him get married.

271.title: CBI refutes Indrani Mukerjea’s claim that Sheena Bora is alive
271.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has refuted former media executive Indrani Mukerjea's claim that her daughter Sheena Bora is alive and residing in Srinagar. Responding to Mukerjea's plea for an investigation of the claim, the agency said, "The plea filed by Mukerjea is frivolous, in which wild claims are made that are not sustainable."

272.title: IPO-bound LIC appoints insurance veteran Sunil Agrawal as CFO: Reports
272.article_body: LIC has appointed former Reliance Nippon Life Insurance CFO Sunil Agrawal as the IPO-bound insurer's CFO, Bloomberg reported. Agrawal served as Nippon's CFO for 12 years till 2018. Prior to that, he worked for ICICI Prudential Life Insurance for five years. He replaced LIC Executive Director Shubhangi Soman and is the first outsider to be appointed to the position.

273.title: Over 97% of adults have received 1st COVID-19 vaccine dose: Govt
273.article_body: Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya tweeted on Thursday that over 97% of India's adult population has received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Rapidly marching towards achieving 100% first dose mark," he added. Notably, at a press meet today, ICMR's Dr Balram Bhargava said the first dose of vaccine is 98.9% effective in preventing mortality.

274.title: Chelsea reach FA Cup quarters as Abramovich announces club is up for sale
274.article_body: Hours after Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich announced he is putting the club up for sale, Chelsea beat Luton Town 3-2 to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Chelsea's £97.5 million record signing Romelu Lukaku scored the winning goal in the fifth-round match. Abramovich has owned the London-based club for nearly 20 years. Chelsea were FA Cup finalists last year.

275.title: Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 to reach FA Cup quarter-finals
275.article_body: Liverpool's Takumi Minamino on Wednesday scored twice to help Liverpool beat Norwich City 2-1 and reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Liverpool beat Chelsea on penalties to win the Carabao Cup on Sunday. "Takumi is an incredible player and tonight was the best game he had for us. He was a constant threat throughout," Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said.

276.title: If you can't close the skies, then give me planes: Ukraine President to the West
276.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on the West to increase military aid to Ukraine and said, "If you do not have the power to close the skies, then give me planes!" "If we (Ukraine) are no more then, God forbid, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia will be next. Believe me," Zelenskyy warned.

277.title: Delhi reports 326 COVID-19 cases, 3 deaths in last 24 hrs
277.article_body: Delhi reported 326 new COVID-19 cases and three related deaths in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,60,887. Moreover, 338 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,588 active cases. The city had reported 325 COVID-19 cases and one death on Wednesday.

278.title: Muslims living in fear, Brahmins neglected under BJP: Mayawati
278.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati on Thursday said, "Muslims are living under constant fear. They have been meted step-motherly treatment by the BJP government. The Brahmin community, too, has been feeling neglected." Mayawati further said that BSP has given tickets to candidates of all communities. "The Muslim community is full of hate against the BJP and the RSS," she added.

279.title: Yet to examine it: Govt on IIT study predicting 4th wave in June
279.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said it's yet to examine the IIT Kanpur study which said that the COVID-19 fourth wave in India may start around June 22 and peak from mid to late August. NITI Aayog Member (Health) VK Paul said the study is a valuable input produced by eminent people. "We should be carefully watching the assumption," he added.

280.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Winter Paralympics: IPC
280.article_body: The International Paralympic Committee (IPC) on Thursday said Russian and Belarusian athletes will be banned from the Winter Paralympics. The decision comes after the IPC faced international backlash and threats of boycotts by other teams for announcing a day before the athletes would be allowed to compete as neutrals. A 71-member Russian contingent and 12-member Belarusian team are in Beijing.

281.title: F1's Max Verstappen signs new deal with Red Bull until end of 2028
281.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen on Thursday signed a new five-year contract extension with Red Bull keeping him at the team until the end of 2028. "I really enjoy being part of Red Bull Racing, so choosing to stay to the 2028 season was an easy decision," Verstappen said. The new deal is reportedly worth £40 million per season.

282.title: 2 dead, 14 hurt as bus falls into gorge in Himachal's Mandi
282.article_body: Two people were killed and 14 others were left injured as a Himachal Road Transport Corporation bus fell into a gorge in Mandi district, police have said. Mandi Superintendent of Police Shalini Agnihotri informed that the accident took place on Thursday at Jhir village of Sarkaghat sub-division. The injured people were taken for treatment to a nearby hospital.

283.title: 35-yr-old arrested in Thane for cheating 35 people of ₹2.56 crore
283.article_body: Thane Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for cheating 35 people of ₹2.56 crores after the promise of giving three times higher returns on their investments. An officer from the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) said, "The accused had taken money from people on a time-to-time basis within a year's span in 2020."

284.title: 'France Prez believes worst is yet to come,' says aide after 90-minute call with Putin
284.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron believes "the worst is yet to come" in Ukraine after a 90-minute phone call with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin who appears intent on seizing "the whole" of Ukraine, Macron's aide said. "There was nothing in what President Putin told us that should reassure us. He showed great determination to continue the operation," the aide continued.

285.title: 8 people can return in its place: BJP MLA on bringing student's body from Ukraine
285.article_body: When asked about bringing Karnataka resident Naveen SG's body from war-hit Ukraine, BJP MLA Arvind Bellad on Thursday said, "In the place required for a dead body, eight persons could be accommodated and brought back." Saying that efforts are underway, he added, "Bringing those who are alive is difficult, so bringing a dead body back would be even more difficult."

286.title: Djokovic likely to play French Open as France drops vaccine rule
286.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic will likely be able to play at French Open in May after France announced it will drop its COVID-19 vaccine pass rule from March 14. Djokovic won the title in 2021, beating world number five Stefanos Tsitsipas in five sets. Djokovic was deported ahead of the Australian Open due to his COVID-19 vaccine status.

287.title: Can't promote drunkenness: Delhi govt on order stopping discount on liquor
287.article_body: Delhi government has told Delhi High Court that the national capital "couldn't become a city for promoting drunkenness through discounts on liquor." The giving of discounts by liquor vends was an attempt by a few to "monopolise" the whole system, it added. It comes as private liquor sellers challenged Delhi government's order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol.

288.title: Turkish AI startup Insider turns unicorn with $121 mn fundraise
288.article_body: Turkish AI startup Insider has become a unicorn after raising $121 million in a funding round led by Qatar's sovereign wealth fund. Insider is now valued at $1.22 billion, triple of what it was valued two years ago. Founded in 2012, the startup's platform uses artificial intelligence to predict future consumption behaviour for clients like Samsung, Toyota and Ikea.

289.title: Drugs, liquor worth over ₹600 crore seized in 2yrs: Gujarat govt
289.article_body: Gujarat government in a written response in the Assembly on Thursday said drugs and liquor worth over ₹600 crore were seized in the state over the last two years. In a break-up, it revealed police confiscated India-made foreign liquor bottles, country liquor and beer cans worth ₹235 crore and hashish, ganja and charas worth ₹370 crore in 2020 and 2021.

290.title: Chhattisgarh CM rides bike in leather jacket to promote competition; video viral
290.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel wore a leather jacket, shades and rode a bike to promote a bike racing competition organised by the Chhattisgarh Motor Sports Association. In a video posted by the Chief Minister's Office on Twitter, Baghel is seen riding the bike, while Punjabi music is playing in the background. "Let's make this weekend memorable," his office tweeted.

291.title: No parent wants to send their child away: PM Modi to Ukraine-returned students
291.article_body: PM Narendra Modi in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi interacted with several Indian medical students who had returned from war-hit Ukraine. The PM said, "I believe, students like you would not have needed to go outside India had the medical education policies been right since the beginning." He added, "No parent wants to send their child away at a small age."

292.title: Man marries triplets on same day after all 3 sisters propose to him in Congo
292.article_body: A man in Democratic Republic of Congo married triplets on the same day and said that they proposed to him simultaneously. "I was obliged to marry all of them because they are triplets. It wasn't an easy decision because until now, my parents don't understand what I'm doing," the man said. Pictures of their wedding are being widely shared online

293.title: 2nd round of Russia-Ukraine talks begins, Ukraine lists 3 key issues
293.article_body: The second round of Russia-Ukraine ceasefire talks has begun, tweeted a Ukrainian official. The key issues on the agenda are immediate ceasefire, armistice and humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians from destroyed or constantly shelled villages/cities, the official further wrote. The Ukrainian official also shared a picture along with the tweet.

294.title: Rohit misinterprets meaning of 'anban' during presser, says 'My Hindi isn't that good'
294.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma misinterpreted the meaning of Hindi word 'anban' while answering a question about whether he has set any targets having played just 40 Tests till now. Rohit answered, "I'm happy having played 40 Tests...I had several injuries and 'anban' during my career." Rohit then asked the meaning of 'anban' and said, "My Hindi isn't that good, boss."

295.title: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank freezes Russia lending
295.article_body: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) on Thursday said it has put all activities relating to Russia and Belarus on hold and under review owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. China, despite being the Bank's largest shareholder and holding 26.5% of AIIB's voting power, has opposed sanctions imposed on Russia by governments of various countries.

296.title: 76-year-old woman arrested in Russia for opposing invasion of Ukraine
296.article_body: A 76-year-old woman was reportedly arrested in Russia as she protested against the country's invasion of Ukraine. A video showing some police officers arresting the woman, who is reportedly the survivor of World War II, has also gone viral online. The woman was reportedly carrying a sign that said, "Soldier, drop your weapon and you will be a true hero."

297.title: 'There is much to life than cricket': Jharkhand's Virat shares Dhoni's advice
297.article_body: Sharing MS Dhoni's advice while playing together for Jharkhand in the 2016-17 season, Jharkhand batter Virat Singh said, "Failures on the cricket ground shouldn't dictate your life. There is much to life than cricket." "It is a game, one day you will score a century and the next day, you might get out without scoring," added Virat.

298.title: Mamata Banerjee having Prime Ministerial illusions: BJP leader
298.article_body: BJP leader Tathagata Roy on Thursday said that West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is having "Prime Ministerial illusions", which is why she's interfering in an international issue. Banerjee on Wednesday blamed the government for delaying the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine. The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday said that 6,400 Indians have been brought back so far.

299.title: Time to send Yogi back to his mutt: Mayawati
299.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati said that her party will form the government in Uttar Pradesh and will send Yogi Adityanath "back to his mutt". "Seeing this turnout and its enthusiasm, I can say that you are set to bring the BSP back to power and make your 'behenji' the Chief Minister for the fifth time," Mayawati added.

300.title: Vodafone Idea to raise ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to promoters
300.article_body: Vodafone Idea (Vi) on Thursday said its board has approved raising ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to its promoters on preferential basis. The firm will issue up to 3.39 billion shares at ₹13.30 a share, 20% premium to its current market price, to Vodafone Group's Euro Pacific Securities and Prime Metals and Aditya Birla Group's (ABG) Oriana Investments.

301.title: Prosecutor of ICC launches investigation into war crimes in Ukraine
301.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan on Wednesday announced he has launched an investigation into war crimes, genocide and crimes against humanity committed during Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The investigation comes after 39 member states referred for an investigation from the ICC. Ukraine has said over 2,000 civilians have died since the invasion began last week.

302.title: Ukrainian soldiers beat us: Rajasthan students after returning from Ukraine
302.article_body: Indian medical students who returned to Rajasthan from war-hit Ukraine said the situation at the country's border with Romania was "horrific". "Ukrainian soldiers were treating us very badly. They were beating boys, firing tear gas shells and also bullets in the air," a female student said. A male student said, "They kicked a girl in front of me. She fainted."

303.title: BJP made Purvanchal education hub, opposition neglected it: Shah
303.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the BJP government made Purvanchal an education hub, while the opposition neglected it earlier. "We made universities in Azamgarh, Ballia and Gorakhpur, along with 12 new medical colleges in the region," Shah added. He further said that BJP has freed UP of the mafia.

304.title: Will impose more sanctions on Russia if situation deteriorates: EU
304.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Thursday said the EU will impose more sanctions on Russia if the situation in Ukraine deteriorates any further following Russia's invasion. The EU has already imposed travel, export, financial and energy bans. "Our aim is to cut off the Kremlin's capacity to wage war on its neighbours," von der Leyen said.

305.title: Video shows captured Ukrainian soldiers being forced to say 'Glory to Russia'
305.article_body: A video purportedly showing captured Ukrainian soldiers being forced to say 'Glory to Russia' has surfaced online. The group of around 15 soldiers can be seen standing at the side of a road as they are recorded by a man. One of the soldiers was told to repeat the phrase loudly by the man behind the camera.

306.title: It's cold, you're wearing just shirt: Rijiju to Indian before evacuation
306.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju who is in Slovakia to see the evacuation of Indian students from Ukraine checked basic facilities for them. In a video shared by him on social media, Rijiju asked one of the Indians, "It is cold...you are wearing just a shirt. I feel cold looking at you." Other students standing there were seen laughing at this.

307.title: Few hundred citizens still remain in Ukraine's Kharkiv: Govt
307.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday said a few hundred Indian nationals are still stuck in Kharkiv of war-hit Ukraine. "Our priority is to take students out safely in whatever mode of transport possible," he said. "The total number of Indians waiting to cross Ukraine's western borders has reduced," he claimed.

308.title: Tried other options before 'I'm Iron Man' line: Robert Downey Jr
308.article_body: Actor Robert Downey Jr recently said in a podcast that before choosing the 'I am Iron Man' line for his character Tony Stark's last words in 'Avengers: Endgame', he tried other lines. He continued, "They were all...smart-a** lines like...dumb stuff like, 'You're so f***ed' or whatever." The actor revealed the final line was one of the editors' or writers' idea.

309.title: Melt snow for water, avoid full meals: Govt in survival guidelines for Indians in Ukraine
309.article_body: In an advisory for Indian citizens in Ukraine, government listed survival guidelines, wherein it asked them to keep a kit of essential items, including passport, ID Card, essential medication, at hand round the clock. "Avoid full meals, eat smaller portions to extend the rations...Melt snow to make water," it added. "Delete...unnecessary apps in mobile...to conserve battery," said government.

310.title: Indian govt lists dos and don'ts in advisory for its citizens in Ukraine
310.article_body: Indian government, in an advisory for its citizens in Ukraine, listed out potentially dangerous situations to be expected, including aerial raids and missile attacks. "Compile and share information with...fellow Indians, organise yourselves in squads...of ten...students, nominate a coordinator," said government. "Do not join local protestors, refrain from commenting on social media," it added.

311.title: We will restore every house, every street, Russia will pay for it: Ukraine
311.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said, "We will restore every house, every street and every city destroyed in the war." Zelenskyy said, "We say to Russia: Learn the word of reparations and contributions." He added, "You (Russia) will reimburse us for everything you did against our state, against every Ukrainian in full."

312.title: Man shares pic of son resting on his uniform as he goes to fight for Ukraine
312.article_body: A Ukrainian man has shared a picture of his son, who can be seen resting on his military uniform as he prepared to fight for the country amid the Russian invasion. The man tweeted, "[Goodbye] my little boy...I hope [to] see you [the other] time I survive." Over 2,000 Ukrainian civilians have reportedly been killed so far since Russia's invasion.

313.title: Russia will achieve its goal in Ukraine in any case: Putin
313.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday told his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron that the goals of Russia's operation in Ukraine - its demilitarisation and neutral status - will be achieved in any case. Putin added that any attempts by Kyiv to delay negotiations would result in Moscow adding more items to its list of demands.

314.title: Kerala, Mizoram & Maha have 50% of India's active COVID cases: Govt
314.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Thursday said Kerala, Maharashtra and Mizoram accounted for 50% of the active COVID-19 cases in India. At present, the country has around 77,000 active cases. Only a single state has active cases over 10,000 and two states have active cases between 5,000 and 10,000, while remaining states have below 5,000 active cases, the ministry said.

315.title: Ford names its EV unit 'Model e', the name it stopped Elon Musk from using
315.article_body: Ford has split its business into two separate entities, one focused on electric vehicles and the other on gas-powered ones. Ford named its electric vehicle unit 'Ford Model e' and the gasoline division 'Ford Blue'. Nearly a decade ago, Ford had stopped Elon Musk's Tesla from naming its car 'Model E' and Tesla eventually named its car 'Model 3'.

316.title: 18,000 Indians left Ukraine since we first issued advisory: MEA
316.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said a total of 18,000 Indian nationals have left Ukraine since the first travel advisory was issued by the Indian Embassy in Kyiv. "30 flights under Operation Ganga have brought back 6,400 Indians from Ukraine so far. In the next 24 hours, 18 flights have been scheduled," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi.

317.title: Ensure you're vaccinated against COVID-19: Govt to Ukraine returnees
317.article_body: The government on Thursday asked all students who have returned from war-hit Ukraine to get fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if they haven't done so already. Health Ministry's Lav Agarwal said the ministry is in regular touch with the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) over how many flights and people have come from Ukraine and their health status as well.

318.title: Ukrainian woman killed while trying to recover 14-yr-old nephew's body
318.article_body: A nurse has been killed in an ambush by Russian forces while she was trying to recover her 14-year-old nephew's body, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. The woman's nephew was reportedly killed by shrapnel after the Russian bombing. Ukraine's Healthcare Minister Viktor Liashko said, "Today Russian terrorists took the life of a doctor – Marina Kalabina...[This] should definitely not go unpunished."

319.title: Eveready's Chairman & MD resign post open offer from Burman family
319.article_body: Eveready's Non-Executive Chairman Aditya Khaitan and Managing Director Amritanshu Khaitan resigned from their positions following an open offer from Dabur Group's Burman family to buy an additional 26% stake in Eveready. The company said the two have stepped down "to enable [Eveready] to benefit from new leadership and direction". Joint MD Suvamoy Saha will assume charge as Eveready's interim MD.

320.title: Chennai to get its youngest Mayor as DMK names 28-yr-old R Priya for post
320.article_body: DMK on Thursday named 28-year-old R Priya as the mayoral candidate for Chennai. As DMK enjoys the majority, Priya would be formally elected as Chennai's youngest Mayor soon. Priya will be the first-ever Dalit woman and the third woman after Tara Cherian and Kamakshi Jayaraman to lead the body. She is the granddaughter of former DMK MLA Chengai Sivam.

321.title: Formula 1 terminates contract with Russian Grand Prix
321.article_body: Formula 1 has confirmed that it has terminated its contract with the Russian Grand Prix amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Formula 1 had earlier cancelled the race scheduled to take place in Sochi in September. Formula 1's governing body, FIA, had ruled that Russian drivers must compete under a neutral flag this season.

322.title: 1 million people have fled Ukraine in 7 days since Russia invasion: UN
322.article_body: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Wednesday said that about one million people have fled Ukraine since Russia invaded the country on February 24. Filippo Grandi said, "In just seven days, we have witnessed the exodus of one million refugees from Ukraine to neighbouring countries." Notably, the Russia-Ukraine war entered its eighth day today.

323.title: Man ties wife & her alleged lover, beats them with baton in Raj
323.article_body: A man was arrested for beating his wife and her alleged lover after tying them up to a pillar in Rajasthan's Udaipur district, police said on Thursday. The accused, identified as Kanhaiya Lal, beat the man till he fainted and later shaved his head, said Station House Officer (SHO) of Pahada Police Station Nagendra Singh.

324.title: Satellite pic shows people waiting in long queue for food in Ukraine
324.article_body: A satellite image by Maxar amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine shows long queue of people waiting for essentials outside a shop. The long queue waiting for food was seen outside a supermarket in Kyiv. People and cars trying to leave Ukraine at multiple border crossing points and into neighbouring countries including Hungary and Slovakia are also seen in pictures.

325.title: 18-month-old Hyd girl kidnapped from hospital, rescued within 4 hours
325.article_body: An 18-month-old girl who was kidnapped from the Niloufer Hospital at Hyderabad's Nampally on Wednesday morning was rescued within four hours, police said. The child had gone to the hospital along with her mother. While her mother was busy collecting reports, the girl went missing within a few minutes.

326.title: Nobody should say what India should do, its voice matters: France on Russia-Ukraine war
326.article_body: After India abstained from voting on the resolution against Russia at UNSC, French Ambassador to India Emmanuel Lenain on Thursday said, "Nobody should say what India should do." "As crisis is deepening, support from India would be welcomed because India's voice matters," he stated. He added that France is a strong supporter of India getting a permanent seat in UNSC.

327.title: Interviewer jokingly makes Zuckerberg complete CAPTCHA to prove he's 'not a robot'
327.article_body: Computer scientist Lex Fridman recently interviewed Mark Zuckerberg where he jokingly made the Meta CEO complete a CAPTCHA to prove that he is "not a robot". Fridman asked Zuckerberg to circle all the traffic lights on a paper presented to him. CAPTCHA is a type of challenge-response test used in computing to determine whether the user is human.

328.title: I had no idea there was such a shortfall of medical colleges in India: Mahindra
328.article_body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday tweeted, "I had no idea that there was such a shortfall  of medical colleges in India." The billionaire tweeted this in response to a graphic that listed the top destinations for Indian medical students and the number of students who are there. It stated that 23,000 Indian medical students are in China alone.

329.title: Man sexually harasses woman passenger on Delhi-B'luru flight; booked
329.article_body: A man allegedly sexually harassed a 34-year-old woman passenger mid-air on a flight to Bengaluru from Delhi, a report said. The woman alleged the accused tried to speak with her a few times, touched her inappropriately and started leaning on her shoulders 30 minutes after the flight took off. Meanwhile, Bengaluru's airport police have booked the man following the incident.

330.title: Mumbai Police banishes 2 women for 1 year over drug racket
330.article_body: The Mumbai Police banished two women for a year for allegedly running a network of drug peddlers in the absence of their jailed husbands. While 33-year-old Tehseen Bano Ali Sheikh allegedly ran the drug racket from eastern Mumbai, 30-year-old Firdous Rashid Sheikh was a key gang member. Both are residents of Trombay. This punishment is usually given to habitual criminals.

331.title: Man dies after entering Pune septic tank, wife says he was forced to do it
331.article_body: The wife of a 36-year-old tenant, who died while trying to rescue three workers cleaning a septic tank in Pune, has alleged that her husband was forced to enter it by the building's owner. In her FIR, the woman also said that no protective gear and safety equipment was given by the owner. Police arrested the owner on Thursday.

332.title: Delhi man succumbs to injuries days after he was found in pool of blood
332.article_body: A 40-year-old man succumbed to the injuries he received after being beaten up by some people in Delhi's Sadar Bazar area, police said. The man was taken to hospital by his nephew who saw him lying in a pool of blood near Rui Mandi on Sunday. Deputy Commissioner of Police (North) said one person has been arrested in this connection.

333.title: SIT formed to probe the death of 16-yr-old DPS Faridabad student
333.article_body: Faridabad Police on Wednesday formed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the case filed by the mother of the 16-year-old Delhi Public School (DPS) Faridabad student, who allegedly died by suicide on February 24. The mother alleged that her child was harassed over his sexuality and despite complaining to school authorities several times, her complaints were ignored.

334.title: 650 Delhi residents stuck in Ukraine, 215 returned: Officials
334.article_body: Around 650 Delhi residents are still stuck in Ukraine, while 215 people belonging to the city have been brought back, Delhi government officials said on Thursday. "The Delhi government is constantly in touch with the families of those stranded in Ukraine," said Transport Minister of Delhi, Kailash Gahlot. Families of over 600 such students were contacted over phone, officials added.

335.title: Chennai to gets its youngest Mayor as DMK names 28-yr-old R Priya for post
335.article_body: DMK on Thursday named 28-year-old R Priya as the mayoral candidate for Chennai. As DMK enjoys the majority, Priya would be formally elected as Chennai's youngest Mayor soon. Priya will be the first-ever Dalit woman and the third woman after Tara Cherian and Kamakshi Jayaraman to lead the body. Priya is the granddaughter of former DMK MLA Chengai Sivam.

336.title: Photo from space shows houses burning in Ukraine
336.article_body: A satellite photo released by Maxar Technologies shows burning houses in Ukraine's Rivnopillya amid war with Russia. Shelling and bombings have been witnessed in several cities of Ukraine since Russia announced military operations in the country. Several other satellite images showed burning factories, craters and damaged bridge in other cities.

337.title: COVID vaccine efficiency is 98.9% post 1st dose, 99.3% post 2nd: ICMR
337.article_body: ICMR chief Dr Balram Bhargava on Thursday said vaccine effectiveness in mortality prevention has been measured. "The first dose is responsible for 98.9% vaccine effectiveness and if both doses are given then it is 99.3% effective," Dr Bhargava said. "During 2022, 92% of deaths have been due to unvaccinated individuals," he added.

338.title: South Korean Prime Minister Kim Boo-kyum tests positive for COVID-19
338.article_body: South Korean Prime Minister Kim Boo-kyum's office on Thursday said he has tested positive for COVID-19. "He was coughing a bit this morning but is now only having mild cold symptoms," an official said. His office added that Boo-kyum has begun receiving treatment at home. The Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency on Wednesday reported 1,98,803 new COVID-19 cases.

339.title: Ikea suspends Russia, Belarus operations; 15,000 staff to be affected
339.article_body: Ikea on Thursday said it would suspend its operations in Russia and Belarus in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. The shutdown of operations will affect 15,000 employees, 17 stores and three production sites. "The war has had a huge human impact already. It is also resulting in serious disruptions to supply chain and trading conditions," the company said.

340.title: Ukrainian girl gives 'Stop Putin' poster to Prince Charles; pic surfaces
340.article_body: A picture showing a young Ukrainian girl giving a poster that said 'Stop Putin' to the UK's Prince Charles has surfaced online. The girl gave the poster to Charles as he visited the Ukrainian Catholic Cathedral in London to show solidarity with Ukrainians amid the Russian invasion. Charles also praised the "extraordinary bravery" of Ukrainian people amid "truly terrible aggression".

341.title: Let them fly on broomsticks: Russia as it stops delivering rocket engines to US
341.article_body: Russian state space agency Roscosmos' head Dmitry Rogozin has said that Russia has decided to stop supplying rocket engines to the US in retaliation for its sanctions over Ukraine. "In a situation like this we can't supply the United States with our world's best rocket engines. Let them fly on something else, their broomsticks, I don't know what," Rogozin added.

342.title: Ukrainians ride on top of captured Russian tank, shout 'We did it'; video viral
342.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media, showing a group of Ukrainians riding on top of a Russian tank they "captured". As the group laughed and cheered, one of the men shouted, "We did it" and "glory to Ukraine". Ukraine authorities have said that seized Russian tanks don't need to be declared on the tax form.

343.title: Asking women 'why don't they want kids' can affect their mental health: Debina
343.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee shared a video in which she discussed how "it's not okay" to ask women pregnancy-related questions. She added it must be difficult for a woman in physical and mental distress to be asked questions like "when are they going to become a mother?" and "why don't they want kids?" by others who aren't aware of her situation.

344.title: Around 5 lakh people told to evacuate amid flood warnings in Sydney
344.article_body: Around five lakh Australians were ordered on Thursday to either evacuate their homes or prepare to flee floodwaters as heavy rains triggered flash floods in Sydney and across Australia's east coast over the past week. At least 13 people have died so far. Australia's Bureau of Meteorology has warned of fatal flash flooding and winds in excess of 90 kmph.

345.title: Don't give free gold: Varun to a fan who offered him free gold jewellery
345.article_body: A video surfaced online, in which a fan invited Varun Dhawan to visit her jewellery store. In the video, Varun is seen posing with her for pictures. Later, the fan tells him that she'll not charge him if he visits her store. Varun jokingly responds, "Don't give free gold." Then the fan clarifies she won't charge him any making charges.

346.title: Man dragged while getting down from moving train in Guj, video surfaces
346.article_body: The Railways Ministry tweeted a video on Tuesday showing a passenger being dragged on the platform after he tried to get down from a moving train at Surat railway station in Gujarat. Reportedly, the train was moving at 20 kmph when the incident happened. The man said to be in his 40s got saved after the guard applied emergency brakes.
