347.title: France 'strongly' urges its citizens to leave Russia amid conflict
347.article_body: The French government has "strongly" urged its citizens to leave Russia if their presence is "not essential". This comes following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine and the closure of airspace between Russia and the European Union. The government also urged French citizens to "defer any trips to Russia". The US on Monday issued a similar appeal to American nationals in Russia.

348.title: Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test is momentous for Indian cricket: Ganguly
348.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test in Mohali tomorrow is momentous for Indian cricket. "Virat has had a fantastic career. He still has time to achieve greater milestones," added Ganguly in a video message shared by BCCI. Virat will become the 12th Indian cricketer to play 100 Tests.

349.title: I dumped my bags to carry my dog: Indian girl seen in viral pic on escaping from Ukraine
349.article_body: Indian student Arya Aldrin, who carried her pet dog Zaira from Ukraine amid war, arrived in Delhi on Thursday. "At one stretch, I had to walk 20 km...At one point she was tired...so I dumped my bags to carry her," said Arya. "I was firm...Zaira will accompany me...Some people laughed at me," the 2nd year MBBS student from Kerala added.

350.title: 'Jhund' is a masterpiece and will make a lot of heads turn: Dhanush
350.article_body: Talking about Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund', Dhanush said the movie is simply mind-blowing and a masterpiece, adding that the film will make a lot of heads turn and is an experience that everyone should go through. "Very happy to have witnessed this magic. Speechless. Simply fantastic," stated Dhanush. "Amit ji has done unbelievable work," said Dhanush.

351.title: Nawab Malik's ED custody extended till March 7 in money laundering case
351.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has been granted additional custody of Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik till March 7 by a PMLA court. The NCP leader was arrested in connection with a money laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim. He has claimed that ED is acting against him out of political vendetta as he has been critical of the central government.

352.title: Priyanka lights diya while offering prayers in Varanasi, video surfaces
352.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra offered prayers on the banks of the Ganga river in Varanasi. In a video that has surfaced on social media, she can be seen lighting a 'diya' and offering it in the Ganga river. Priyanka reached Kabir Chaura Math in Varanasi on Thursday and she is expected to stay there for the next three days.

353.title: Tigress rescued from tiger reserve dies during treatment at Bilaspur Zoo
353.article_body: A 13-year-old tigress died during treatment in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur district on Wednesday, a forest official said. The tigress was rescued from Achanakmar Tiger Reserve in June last year and was taken to Kanan Pendari Zoological Garden in Bilaspur for treatment. A seven-member committee was formed for her treatment, however, the animal died due to age-related ailments.

354.title: B'luru man poses as software engineer, cheats Raj local of ₹1.76 crore
354.article_body: A man was arrested in Bengaluru for cheating a resident of Rajasthan's Udaipur of ₹1.76 crore, police said. He posed as a software engineer from Apple and told the victim he could get him iPhones at prices 30-40% cheaper than the market. Subsequently, the victim paid him the amount in instalments and got cheated. The accused was brought to Udaipur.

355.title: Gold ornaments worth ₹16 crore seized on Konark express, 4 held
355.article_body: Gold ornaments worth ₹16 crore were seized from Mumbai-Bhubaneswar Konark Express by the Government Railway Police (GRP). Four people were said to have been detained in connection with the incident for interrogation after they failed to produce valid GST documents. Police said the detainees had been travelling with four bags, each containing 8 kg of gold ornaments.

356.title: Sharp dip in COVID-19 cases, 0.7% of global cases from India: Govt
356.article_body: Union Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said on Thursday a sharp decline in COVID-19 cases has been observed and that only 0.7% of global cases are reported in India. "On (an) average around 11,000 COVID-19 cases are reported on a weekly basis in India," he said. The active caseload has also declined to 77,000, the government said.

357.title: Today, music is made for Instagram Reels and that's sad: Salim Merchant
357.article_body: Music composer Salim Merchant said that music today requires social media validation. "Today, music is made for Instagram Reels...Even creators are making music that's pleasing to ears for a short span of time. That's sad," he added. Salim said that he also doesn't find films very exciting nowadays. "I shouldn't be saying it, but it's the truth," he added.

358.title: Should I run away like our seculars surrendered to terrorism?: Vivek
358.article_body: Talking about the release of his upcoming film 'The Kashmir Files' clashing with Prabhas-starrer 'Radhe Shyam', director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Should I...run away like our...seculars..., intellectuals surrendered to terrorism in case of Kashmir Genocide?" "Should I surrender to the might? Whenever I release 'The Kashmir Files' a...star based, hyped up film will release alongside," added Vivek.

359.title: Siraj can bowl long overs, he has shown he can bowl tough overs: Agarkar
359.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said pacer Mohammed Siraj is someone who can bowl the "long overs" for the team in Tests. "Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami are back...[but] whether in England or at times in South Africa, Siraj has shown that he can bowl the tough overs," Agarkar added. So far, Siraj has picked 36 wickets in 12 Tests.

360.title: Palihapitiya accused of insider sale of Virgin Galactic shares worth $315 mn
360.article_body: Former Virgin Galactic Chairman Chamath Palihapitiya has been accused of selling 10 million of firm's shares for $315 million by leveraging his position before quitting. The lawsuit also alleges Founder Richard Branson nabbed $301 million by selling shares while stock price was "artificially inflated". The suit was filed on behalf of Virgin Galactic to seek damages from directors and officers.

361.title: BSF seizes silver worth ₹2 lakh from farmer on Indo-Bangladesh border
361.article_body: The BSF seized silver balls worth ₹2 lakh from a suspected farmer on the Indo-Bangladesh border on Tuesday. The discovery was made after a soldier on duty saw a suspicious person carrying some luggage on cycle and stopped the person to search the goods. An FIR was lodged against the suspect, identified as Rabban Sheikh, at Lalgola Police Station.

362.title: This is the spirit in which foreign policy should be run: Tharoor on meet with Jaishankar
362.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday praised External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for a "comprehensive briefing" on the evacuation of Indians from war-torn Ukraine. "This is the spirit in which foreign policy should be run," Tharoor tweeted after the meeting. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi were also part of the meeting that discussed Russia-Ukraine crisis.

363.title: It won't make a difference: Gavaskar on Bumrah's inexperience in home Tests
363.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar, on being asked if Jasprit Bumrah's inexperience at home will affect his performance in Sri Lanka Tests, said Bumrah is too good a bowler and it won't make a difference. So far, Bumrah has played only two of his 27 Tests on home soil. "Any kind of conditions, he will get you wickets anytime," Gavaskar added.

364.title: Kohli used to be a chubby guy who would eat anything: Harbhajan
364.article_body: Terming Virat Kohli's will to succeed as "unbelievable", Harbhajan Singh said Kohli brought about a transformation in Team India's fitness culture having earlier been a "chubby guy" who would eat "anything and everything". "After a few years when I saw him, he was totally a different guy, knowing...what he wants to do, what is good for him," added Harbhajan.

365.title: Fire breaks out in Zakaria Industrial Estate in Mumbai's Byculla
365.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in the Zakaria Industrial Estate of Byculla in Mumbai on Thursday. As many as eight fire tenders were rushed to the spot to douse the fire. As per the officials, firefighting operations were immediately launched. The cause that led to the fire has, however, not yet been determined.

366.title: Multi-crore inland waterway project to be developed in Mizoram
366.article_body: An inland waterway transport project will be developed across a 23-km stretch of Khawthlangtuipui-Tuichawng rivers in Mizoram, an official said. The project, estimated to cost ₹22.93 crore, will cater to the needs of the southern districts. "We must optimally utilise our rivers as economic, swift and ecologically sound means of transport," Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal said on Wednesday.

367.title: Gurugram to get 90 smart signals to ease traffic flow: GMDA officials
367.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) has started working on a project to convert 90 traffic signals in the city to smart signals to ease traffic flow, officials said on Wednesday. The authority has already issued tenders for the project and the work will begin within the next two months, officials added.

368.title: I never thought I will play 100 Test matches, God has been kind: Virat Kohli
368.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli, who will feature in his 100th Test starting tomorrow, said that he never thought he will play 100 Test matches. "It has been a long journey...I am just grateful that I have been able to make it to 100. God has been kind," he said. Kohli has scored 7,962 runs in 99 Tests.

369.title: Irfan Pathan congratulates Kohli on 100th Test, calls him 'magical physio'
369.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to congratulate Virat Kohli, who will feature in his 100th Test for India tomorrow. "Test cricket was limping & that's when it found a magical physio in Kohli. He came, he conquered & he made everyone love Test cricket all over again! Congratulations on your remarkable achievement," Irfan wrote.

370.title: Tesla German Gigafactory approval decision to be declared tomorrow
370.article_body: The German state of Brandenburg will be announcing its decision on approval for the planned Tesla Gigafactory near Berlin in a news conference on Friday. "The approval procedure for the e-car and battery factory of...Tesla in Gruenheide in Brandenburg is nearing completion," the state government said. Earlier, reports had said Tesla had won final approval from the state environment office.

371.title: Who is Viktor Yanukovych, who may be Russia's pick for Ukraine President after war?
371.article_body: Russia is reportedly backing exiled former Ukraine President Viktor Yanukovych to take charge if the current regime falls. Yanukovych came to power in 2010 but was overthrown after violent protests in 2014. Protests erupted after he refused to sign a trade deal with EU as he sought closer ties with Russia. He had escaped to Russia, allegedly with Russian help.

372.title: How can Indian investors trade in US stocks like Tesla through NSE IFSC?
372.article_body: Indian retail investors will be able to trade in eight US stocks, including Tesla, through NSE IFSC platform from today. The platform's market makers will buy shares in US and issue receipts against them to investors. The receipts, issued at low costs, will represent a fraction of the value of shares. Trading in receipts will take place in US dollars.

373.title: 249 students from Himachal still stuck in Ukraine: CM Jai Ram Thakur
373.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Thursday said that 249 students from the state are still stranded in war-torn Ukraine and that the efforts were being made at war-footing to evacuate them to neighbouring countries. "The parents of 163 students have been contacted," he said. Thakur thanked PM Narendra Modi for roping in Indian Air Force for evacuation.

374.title: YouTube's creators contributed ₹6,800 cr to Indian GDP in 2020: Report
374.article_body: Google-owned YouTube on Thursday said its creator ecosystem in India contributed ₹6,800 crore to India's GDP and supported an equivalent of 6,83,900 full-time jobs in the country in 2020. YouTube cited an Oxford Economics report while sharing the company's economic impact in India. "Impact [of our creators, artists] on the economy's overall success will only continue to accelerate," YouTube said.

375.title: 3,726 Indians to return from Ukraine today: Union Minister Scindia
375.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday said 3,726 Indians will be brought back home on Thursday. "With all hands on deck and the direction of PM Narendra Modi ji, we will get 3,726 of our people back home today," Scindia said. Eight flights are scheduled from Bucharest, two from Suceava, one from Kosice, five from Budapest and three from Rzeszow.

376.title: I don't do the PR looks actors do; don't feel the need to be seen: Abhimanyu
376.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree's son, actor Abhimanyu Dassani said he's quite content with the pace of his career and doesn't get bothered by the pace of other actors' careers. He added, "I don't feel the need to be seen. That's why you...don't see me doing the PR looks people do." Abhimanyu said as an actor he'd just like to do "good work".

377.title: From one self-made actor: Yami thanks Kangana for praising her in A Thursday
377.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actress Yami Gautam thanked Kangana Ranaut after she praised her for 'A Thursday'. On Wednesday, Kangana shared a poster of the film featuring Yami on her Instagram Stories, and wrote "Congratulations to Team...@yamigautam." Yami shared Kangana's post, and wrote, "Thank you Kangana. Means a lot, especially when it comes from one self-made actor to another."

378.title: BJP workers hit my car with sticks in Varanasi, told me to go back: Mamata
378.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday alleged that yesterday, during her visit to Varanasi, some BJP workers hit her car with sticks and asked her to go back. "Yesterday, when I was going to ghat from the airport, I saw some BJP workers...Stopping my vehicle. They hit my car with sticks and told me to go back," Banerjee added.

379.title: Ukrainian diplomats in Russia moved to Latvia amid war
379.article_body: Ukrainian diplomats in Moscow have been moved to Latvia amid the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The diplomats had left Moscow and crossed the Latvian-Russian border on Wednesday night, Latvia's Foreign Minister Edgars Rinkevics tweeted on Thursday. Latvia, last week, had said that it would give refuge to the diplomats after receiving their plea for help.

380.title: Massive landslide blocks Jammu-Srinagar National Highway
380.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Traffic Police on Thursday morning informed that a massive landslide near Banihal town in Ramban district of the state has blocked the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway. Vehicular movement on the highway has, thus, been suspended, the traffic police added. A video showing boulders tumbling down the hill at the Shabanbas area on the highway was shared by ANI.

381.title: Russian soldiers are 'confused children who have been used': Ukraine President
381.article_body: In a video address to the nation, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called on Russian soldiers to "go home", and described them as "confused children who have been used". Zelenskyy also asked Ukrainians to keep up their resistance. His comments came as Russia acknowledged for the first time since the start of invasion that nearly 500 Russian troops have been killed.

382.title: Chinese company Huawei accused of tax evasion in India: Report
382.article_body: A tax investigation on China's Huawei Technologies allegedly found that the telecoms equipment maker manipulated account books to reduce its taxable income in India, Reuters reported citing a government source. On Thursday, the Finance Ministry said that a "major telecom group" did not account for income of ₹400 crore in its books and couldn't justify expenses of ₹480 crore.

383.title: Will explore all options to restore OBC quota for local polls: Maha Min
383.article_body: Speaking on restoration of Other Backward Class (OBC) quota in the local bodies' elections, Maharashtra OBC welfare minister Vijay Wadettiwar said that the state government will discuss the matter and explore all options to restore it. This comes after BJP alleged that the state government did not properly study the report prepared by MSBCC before submitting it to Supreme Court.

384.title: Sarpanch nominee digs up roads, damages street lights after losing in Odisha
384.article_body: Upset over his defeat in elections, a sarpanch candidate in Odisha's Gajapati district allegedly dug up roads and damaged street lights on Monday. Barik Sabar had lost to Haribandhu Karjee in Gangabada panchayat of the district. He along with his supporters reportedly damaged the road near Badadebula village and put stones on the way, thus, blocking communication with five villages.

385.title: Don't kick out Chelsea's owner Abramovich from English football: Neville
385.article_body: Talking about Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich who's been termed one of Vladimir Putin's closest friends by Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss, ex-Manchester United player Gary Neville said Abramovich shouldn't be "kicked" out of English football. Abramovich has announced his decision to sell Chelsea with net proceeds from the sale set to be donated to "victims of the war in Ukraine".

386.title: Naveen's death a reflection of NEET's shameless face: Kumaraswamy
386.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that the tragic death of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar in Ukraine is a reflection of the NEET's "shameless face". NEET is causing injustice to talented but economically vulnerable rural students in the guise of qualification, he added. The youngster's death has made India question its "self-conscience", he further said.

387.title: India's COVID-19 death toll suspect, says Chidambaram citing Science journal
387.article_body: Citing the academic journal Science, Congress leader P Chidambaram said the official number of deaths due to COVID-19 in India is suspect. "The COVID-19 toll in India between 1/6/2020 and 1/7/2021 was 32,00,000, eight times the official toll of 4,00,000," Chidambaram tweeted. "Government’s figures suggest that the average number of deaths per village was less than one! Unbelievable!" he added.

388.title: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM raises $65 million in funding
388.article_body: Audio streaming platform Pocket FM announced it has raised $65 million in its Series C round of funding. The round was led by Goodwater Capital, Naver and existing investor Tanglin Venture Partners. Founded in 2018 by Rohan Nayak, Nishanth Srinivas and Prateek Dixit, Pocket FM offers content in Hindi, Bengali and Tamil. It had raised $22.4 million in December.

389.title: Meerut jeweller dies by suicide over ₹3 crore debt: Police
389.article_body: A 45-year-old jeweller, reeling under a debt of ₹3 crore, has died by suicide in Meerut, police said. His body was found at his residence in the Thatherwada area of the city. Apart from debt, a dispute with his wife and brother forced the deceased to end his life, police added. Meanwhile, his brother has alleged foul play suspecting murder.

390.title: Would go with Vihari over Shubman as he hasn't made any mistake: Jaffer
390.article_body: With Cheteshwar Pujara dropped from India Test squad, Wasim Jaffer said he would go with Hanuma Vihari over Shubman Gill at the number three position as Vihari hasn't made any mistake to miss out. Jaffer added that Vihari hasn't got "many" chances after his 259-ball 62*-run partnership with Ravichandran Ashwin, in the Sydney Test of India's 2020-21 series against Australia.

391.title: Idea of 'nuclear war' spinning in Western politicians' heads: Russia
391.article_body: Amid war between Russia and Ukraine, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said, "It's in the heads of Western politicians that the idea of a nuclear war is spinning constantly and not in the heads of Russians." This comes a day after Lavrov said that if World War 3 takes place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive.

392.title: Producers will be in shock: Prabhas on low cap on movie ticket prices
392.article_body: Discussing the decision by the Andhra Pradesh government to place a low cap on the prices of movie tickets, actor Prabhas said producers of films like his movie 'Radhe Shyam' will be in "shock". "It takes away 40-50 percent of business so it's a big loss," added Prabhas. Prabhas is known for acting in the 'Baahubali' film franchise.

393.title: Won't be easy for whoever comes in place of Rahane, Pujara: Rohit
393.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said it won't be easy to fill the shoes of veteran batters Cheteshwar Pujara and Ajinkya Rahane, who have been dropped from the squad for Sri Lanka Tests. He added, "What they've done for this team, you can't put it out in words." Rohit further said, "It's not written...that they won't be considered [in future]."

394.title: UP people want Yogi, not ones who build palaces, buy cars: Ravi Kishan
394.article_body: BJP MP Ravi Kishan has said that UP people would vote for CM Yogi Adityanath in the ongoing elections as he's an "educated man and living a monk's life". Kishan said people don't want ones "who want to decorate their palaces and buy fancy cars". He said this in an apparent reference to SP's Akhilesh Yadav and BSP supremo Mayawati.

395.title: Laughed, cried during narration; agreed on spot: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai...'
395.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he was "laughing through tears" during the narration of 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "I had a tissue box kept on the table which got over by the end of the narration. I was entertained, moved," he said, adding, "I agreed then and there on the spot to be a part of this film."

396.title: 4 IAF aircraft evacuate 798 Indians from Romania, Hungary, Poland
396.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Thursday said four IAF C-17 aircraft have evacuated a total of 798 Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine using airfields in Romania, Hungary and Poland. IAF added that the aircraft also supplied 9.7 tons of relief material. Additionally, three more C-17 aircraft have taken off for the three countries to bring back remaining Indian nationals.

397.title: Netflix co-CEO announces $1 mn donation towards Ukraine relief
397.article_body: Netflix Co-founder and co-CEO Reed Hastings has announced a $1 million donation to an organisation providing emergency relief to Ukraine. In his tweet announcing the donation, Hastings thanked Russian-born Evgeny Afineevsky, who directed the Oscar-nominated documentary 'Winter on Fire: Ukraine's Fight for Freedom' for Netflix in 2015. Netflix has reportedly suspended all future projects in Russia.

398.title: Govt dismisses report claiming 19 lakh kids lost parent to COVID-19
398.article_body: The Ministry of Women and Child Development has dismissed a study by Lancet, which claimed that 19 lakh children in India lost a parent or caregiver to COVID-19. "These findings have no correlation with ground reality in India as reflected from field findings," the ministry said. It added the number of children affected by COVID-19 in India stands at 1,53,827.

399.title: Nobody is asking correct questions, says Rohit during press conference; video viral
399.article_body: A video of India captain Rohit Sharma saying, "Nobody is asking correct questions" during a press conference went viral. A reporter asked him whether first Test against Sri Lanka is going to be played on outfield as he wasn't talking about pitch. "Nobody is asking me questions related to crowd, pitch, team combination. It's good for me actually," Rohit joked.

400.title: I am perceived as a bully, vulture in the TV industry: Urvashi Dholakia
400.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said she is perceived as a "vulture" and too strong-headed like a "bully" in the television industry, adding that there are a "lot" of people who have not appreciated her. "I have just been a woman who has her own opinions. Whether you like it or you don't, that's not my problem," stated Urvashi.

401.title: Kohli keeps track of the performances of every RCB player: Shahbaz
401.article_body: Talking about former RCB captain Virat Kohli, RCB player Shahbaz Ahmed said Kohli keeps track of the performances of every player in the franchise, adding that he shares his feedback at times as well. "Kohli is a bowler's captain. He supports bowlers massively," stated Shahbaz who was signed by RCB for ₹2.4 crore in the mega auction.
